Reviews.Title: “The view is breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyMan3535
Reviews.Content: We booked through our travel agent, and were not disappointed. We stayed in Room 813 (ocean front room) and could not have been more pleased!! Although the hotel is a little older it totally met our needs. We took one look out our lanai, and knew we made the right decision. We could have picked apart little things about our unit, but the point is they would have been little things. The view we had was awesome, the pool was great and the location was great! We noticed the toilet tank had a small drip and by mid week they had taken take of it. The person who takes care of our room made sure to leave new towels daily. We didn't expect her to clean up after us, but she did put the cups and saucers that we left in the sink into the dishwasher. For the price and location we would come here again!! If you are looking for someone to pick up after you daily and a perfect room, do down the road to one of the fancy resorts and pay top dollar. For the difference in price and the location, we can make our own bed, pick up after ourselves and enjoy the view!

Reviews.Title: “"Great place to stay"”
Reviews.Author: Sally T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome. We had a great view. Everything was perfect. Full kitchen and I would stay there again anytime. A hot tub would have been nice but you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: soontoberetiredagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana for a week in March. The studio was one that had not been recently remodeled. It was clean and served our needs very well. I would have upgraded had we been in the area for more than one week. We checked out a two bedroom unit which had been remodeled. It was much nicer and equipped much better. Check out the different units on VRBO to get an idea or what is available.

Reviews.Title: “They never cleaned our room”
Reviews.Author: BlueSky38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and had a wonderful time. They cleaned our room everyday, even doing the dishes for us. This year, the only thing they did was change out our towels and every 3rd day they made our beds (otherwise the beds were unmade). By the end of the week, the room was so dirty it just disgusted me. I called the front desk on a couple of occasions and they said it was their policy to only change out towels and do the beds every 3rd day. We used our beach towels and they never replaced them. The oven worked terribly, shutting on and off, it ended up burning everything I tried to bake. I was very disappointed. Needless to say, I won't ever be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanside with Sea Turtles Feeding in AM!”
Reviews.Author: lizzard76
Reviews.Content: We loved our modern room with washer and dryer, plus free parking! The room had a nice balcony and although we were little far away from the vortex of the "V" shape of the building, which meant we couldn't see much of the ocean, it also meant the room had less foot traffic around it and was very quiet. Staff was friendly. This was a great location. Near enough to Lahaina for our Lua and Whale Watching excursion. If you're more interested in the other side of the island or the national park it's a little bit of a drive on the only main road on the island. There is a pool that has a gate to the beach. We took a beach walk the first morning and saw sea turtles (2 or 3) feeding a few feet from shore. During low tide they come in close to eat whatever is on the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at windy location”
Reviews.Author: michael0357
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights end of February / beginning of March in the Outrigger Royal Kahana on Maui. The Royal Kahana is more a condominium than hotel style accomodation. All rooms have a fully equipped kitchen with all necessary supplies and well maintained. As the rooms are not belonging to the hotel but to indidual owners, they are all a bit different in regard to decoration and in regard to renovation level. Our friends, who stayed there at the same time, had a much nicer and lately renovated room. The rooms have a good size including diner table, sofa and some chairs. In addition we had a nice balcony also with table and chairs, unfortunately with view rather on the neighbour building than on the ocean. Therefore we do recommend to book a room with ocean view, from where you could even watch the whales in the late afternoon. The Royal Kahana is located directly at a small sandy beach with some rocks within the water line, which make the access to the ocean a bit uncomfortable. It's quite steep, so no place to let small children play unattended.There is small swimming pool, too, a nice garden and sufficient number of beach chairs. The latter most likely because people tend to spend the day somewhere at nicer beaches, with golfing or sightseeing. The hotel doesn't have any restaurant but a small snack-bar, which is closing latest at 5.00 p.m. In the garden area the hotel is offering the opportunity for barbecue. In the surroundings you find some restaurants, a small supermarket (Whaler's) and a Shell gas station. Parking is free, but the parking lots are somehow small and the total number seems to be a bit unsufficient in case of a fully booked hotel. During our whole stay we had to learn that the surroundings of the Royal Kahana is a bit more windy and rainy than neighbouring towns like Lahaina and Kaanapali. By the way, in Kaanapali you find beautiful golf courses and the best beaches with public parking free of charge. Upon checking-in the lady at the reception seemd to be a bit unmotivated and not very enthusiastic to welcome new guests, but the other staff was very friendly and helpful. Please avoid to join the offered event on the first morning, where they offer a kind of free breakfast. It's a pure sales promotion and you can spend your time much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good beach, clean accomadations, nice location”
Reviews.Author: tornado17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana and had a lovely experience. I wasn't sure what to expect reading the reviews on here as they varied quite a bit in some cases. The property is on Kahana Beach. It is not a large beach, but it is still very nice. There are some rock sections further out in the water, but we found some very sandy sections too. It is nice to snorkel at and there were turtles roaming about every day. Whales can also be seen at a distance (don't worry not too close!). Overall the property is nice, clean and uncrowded. Our room was an ocean view studio (#904). By no means was it luxury accommodation, but it was adequate. It was spacious, clean, bright, appliances worked perfectly and the view was fantastic. It was great sitting out on our balcony every day looking out on a fantastic view. My only complaint/dislike about our room was the thin walls. We had a couple with a child next door that cried and screamed hours upon hours throughout the day. It is an older building so I'm sure thin walls are a common theme throughout. Staff at the hotel were lovely. The front desk was always helpful. As for shops nearby, there were lots within walking distance and Safeway, Longs, Walgreens, etc... were only an 8-10 minute car ride away. I had some people complain to me how far some things were, but we found it was easy to zip around in our rental car. If you don't have a rental car, as mentioned there's lots within walking distance and there is also a bus stop in front of the property that you can take. Overall it was a good place to base yourself from.

Reviews.Title: “It was a Excellent Condo”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: First time in Maui, wonderful vacation. The condo was exceptional-room 306. It was so clean, offered anything you needed. The people were great and friendly. The pool area was always clean and inviting. It was beautiful facing the ocean, watching the whales. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A little "pearly shell" in Kahana”
Reviews.Author: AnneNYUSA
Reviews.Content: I spent 42 days at the Royal Kahana. Second time I vacationed there. Cannot express the warm hospitality and true "aloha spirit" of the staff, starting with the Reception Desk, housekeeping, groundkeepers, and maintenance workers. The condo unit was superb, clean and well-maintained, with all the necessary kitchen and bath amenities. The views of the ocean, island of Lanai, the frolicking whales, the giant turtles, and magnificent sunsets, all seen from our lanai, were spectacular. The grounds and pool are immaculately maintained. No shortages of lounges, or pool towels. No shortages of smiles. It was truly a great vacation. Making plans to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, clean rooms, great beach.”
Reviews.Author: flyfishmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana February 1 - 8. After reading several reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. Although the rooms were very clean. Fantastic views. We saw whales everyday from our balcony. The elevators were brand new and very quick. Though the property was full, there never seemed to be anyone around. We didn't go into the pool, as there was so much to do in the area. We do wish there was a bar/restaurant at the hotel. But having a refridgerator in the room was nice for afternoon cocktails. Drove to Merrimans for dinner one night. Pricey, but the view and service was incredible. We also went to SeaHouse. View was great. Service awful. You can skip the Brew Pub. Very disappointing, but Dollies across the street a fun place and great pizza. Overall the Outrigger was great. We had a car, but did take a taxi to some restaurants and the prices were ok. I do say, I would recommend this more for families or older clientele. They did a great job though and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A sure thing”
Reviews.Author: daytripperNewYork
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Royal Kahana. We were rewarded with a fine view of the ocean, a clean room and a comfortable bed. The staff was adequate. There is a concierge who made an orientation seminar which was quite helpful if you are unfamiliar with what's on the island of Maui. The location is away from the busyness of Lahaina, snug next to other hotels and condominiums. This condo room has full kitchen facilities as well as a washer/dryer. All the features of the room were in good shape. You are also close to the beach as well as to the heated swimming pool. You'll be given a free tote bag and beach towels to use when you need them. The price is decent. The atmosphere is low key. You'll be shopping to keep the fridge full. Even the parking lot is a friendly area. A sure thing if you to do your own cooking and have a nice view of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Old in more ways than one.”
Reviews.Author: topcatus
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days at the Royal Kahana. Like many of you, we only considered this place because it was part of a Costco package. Really not much too exciting to say about this place. Pros: Clean updated lobby Very friendly staff Close to the beach Whale sightings during "winter" Cheap if part of a package Here are the down sides. The hotel is old, carpets are old, furnishings are old. We had a 27inch RCA CRT TV in our room with a VHS VCR!!! I know some of you reading this don't even know what half of those letters stand for. The occupants of the hotel were even older! The pool area looked like a cast reunion party for Cocoon 2. I half expected to see large glowing rock-eggs in the pool at night. Nothing against the elderly, but when every one in the "resort" have 30 to 40 years on you, you starts to feel a bit out of place. I think I've seen enough obese, hairy, white dudes in swim trunks to last me a life time! Aside from the age of the residents, the hotel has some serious short-comings. Primary of which are the thinness of the walls and floors. We had an elderly person with a walker in the room above us. So every time he or she moved about the room, it sounded like someone was dragging the coffee table across the floor. Next door, we had two elderly couples very hard of hearing. So conversation was a yelling match between the four of them. "DID YOU SEE MY GLASSES! WHAT? MY GLASSES! OH! NO THANKS! I'VE ALREADY ATE!" Another issue, this was the most un-condo, condo we have ever stayed at. This is my third time renting a condo in Maui and my seventh time renting a condo in Hawaii, so I have a good idea of what to expect in a rental condo. This was not a condo! It is a hotel room with a kitchenette. Unlike a typical condo, actually owned and used by real owners, there were none of the usual conveniences. Normally, there would be beach chairs, coolers, boogie boards, beach umbrellas, maps, CD's, snorkeling equipment and I've even come across bikes for the renter to use. There were none of those things in this "condo". Basically this is an old hotel room with a place to cook. What our room (#1118) reminded me of was the 500 Sq Ft. studio I rented in the early 90's while I was in Grad school. It was like someone had time warped that tiny place on to Maui. Everything was small and old. There wasn't enough space in the kitchen to prep food and cook it. When the fridge cycled on, which it did constantly, it was loud enough to wake you, since it was only 7 feet away from the bed. Lastly, and a major issue is the shape of the building. You don't have to be an architect to know what will happen when you build a "V" shaped hotel in a windy area. Yes! a funnel! When the trade winds pick in the afternoon massive amounts of wind whip through the building creating a LOUD wooshing sound through out the night. So if you leave your widows open at night hoping to hear the surf, all you'll get is something that sounds like a taxing jet all night long! Not a bad place to stay for cheap, but not a resort or condo. This is basically Motel 6 with a kitchenette, on top of a Holiday Inn lobby, on an average beach in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice prices, decent room”
Reviews.Author: cher01ice
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a no frills stay, you've found it. This hotel is more of a condo-type hotel. Its older but the view from the oceanview rooms is fabulous! The beach is a few steps out the back door which is nice too. However, there isn't much of a beach. Coming from Florida, this was a big adjustment and something I found to be the case most places in Hawaii. The staff was very friendly. The location was convenient to Whaler's Market and Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abbysunlover
Reviews.Content: Party of three adults and one 11 year old stayed from Jan 13 - 23. I could not believe the views. We were on the 12th floor ocean front. When we walked in we all ran around looking at the amenities. The wrap around lani with the outrageous views. The size of the unit was immense. A large 60" tv in the living room. Omg. You do have to sign up for wifi but is available. Cheapest to do a whole month if staying longer than a week. The unit was nicely taken care of for the age of the building. The kitchen look as if had recently been remodeled. Stainless appliances and all the pot and utensils you would need. Was missing a baking pan if you wanted to make a pizza or bake. I ended up using the broiling pan drip tray. When we left we still had some things not eaten. We did leave. There was nothing when we arrived. It is too bad no spices or even seasonings in unit. I guess this might be a health issue? Everything seemed in great order. A/C in spare bed was a bit noisey, but we got used to. All in all we would definitely stay again. We heard that this condo has one of the few heated pools in the area. Oh almost every day we saw turtles and whales. Turtles up near the shore. Whales out further. Bring binoculars or get some at Costco. We could see the whales breaching and splashing. I hope other find this help full. The housekeeping is lite. They come in and do garbages and toilet paper. If you need something they are always happy to get for you. Their is also the bonus of the washer and dryer. Would love to come again. I think next time we will hit a different island, but if I come back I would stay here. Aloha and Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Would return! Great place!”
Reviews.Author: losierc
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 12th floor, amazing view of the ocean, great room altough a bit outdated. Staff at front desk were really nice and the concierge desk very helpful as well. You are approximately 20 steps from the ocean which is really convenient and the pool is good too! No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Very Outdated 35 year old Hotel, Rundown. Ocean Front View Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: jen739
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week from January 4-11, 2012.Let me start with the positives. The pool is heated which was very nice and the Ocean Front Condo View was spectacular! We reserved a Ocean View Condo, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms our first unit was on the 12th floor overlooking a building with a partial ocean view. We were very upset as I paid $4,500.00 for the unit for 4 adults and a 15 year old boy. We were moved to unit 810 which was a stunning shoreline view. Excellent for seeing the whales and turtles... Very spacious.The carpets were stained, and the furniture very old and worn... but the thing that really grossed us out was there was a unlocked cupboard in the kitchen which had mold, bugs, food from 20 plus years a jar of rancid lard. It actually kept me up all night fearing bugs would be crawling on me. We complained and they locked the cupboard saying it is the "Owners" and they can't touch it. Needless to say after that I wore shoes everywhere and sanitized everything in the dishwasher. The hotel was supposed to have Air Conditioning and it was pre-set and it couldn't go below 73.5 which I don't call A/C and the ceiling fan was almost non-existant. I feel it was very poor value for what I paid. For our week in Waikiki Beach on Oahu we stayed at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach and it was a lovely Hotel, you couldn't possibly compare the 2 Outriggers.I am very dissapointed and it wasn't a nice way to end our 3 week vacation in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: parallel40
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and thought it was a good value. All the appliances worked well and the bed was comfortable. Our ocean view was partly obscured by another building. Beach is non-existent. You need a car if you stay here, which was OK for us because we are familiar with the area.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Chris1529
Reviews.Content: Pros: The views of the ocean were beautiful (we got to watch humpback whales and sea turtles from our room), the rooms were spacious, we loved the patio, and we appreciated the in-suite laundry and kitchen stocked with all the dishes and appliances we needed. Cons: Service wasn't very good - The staff was borderline rude; housekeeping would take away our dirty towels but constantly kept forgetting to replace them. Cleanliness was a bit lacking - sheets and towels were clean, but there was a lot of grime around the faucets, door handles, etc. The place was a bit run down as well - one of the three elevators was out of service the entire time we were there, and a second was on the fritz and not always working. Overall, it's a good value, but I wasn't overly impressed and probably wouldn't book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 1113 - Good Value for a comfortable home base.”
Reviews.Author: SusanF54
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious, good location for exploring the beaches of the area but not really a place to hang out. The swimming/beach is not so good and the water clarity in the pool was cloudy. Also, the mattress in this unit was terrible. When the wind gust all the doors slam shut and there's a loud howling throughout. A/C is weak. Staff are lethargic, but responded promptly to our few requests. Still just two elevators but we had little wait even over Christmas when the place was full. Next time, back to Kaanapili Beach, simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “Why Pay Too Much”
Reviews.Author: Goodwrench2000
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Royal Kahana. We have absolutely enjoyed all of them. The property is managed by Outrigger Hawaii, but all of the condos are individually owned. Upon our arrival the 2 bedroom that we reserved was unavailable for the first night, due to an owners' meeting. We were given 2 one-bedrooms and then upgraded to an ocean-front 2-bedroom at no charge. They also moved all of our belongings including the food we had bought for the stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is self-service, so if you are expecting hotel amenities like a bellman, you are at the wrong place. Parking is free, but can be tight, but I never failed to find a spot. The pool is well-maintained and pleasant as are the barbecue areas. There is no restaurant on property, but plenty of them close-by. Being a former longtime Hawaii resident, I was more interested in a great location and saving money than in a hotel-resort experience. If you like to save on meals and and other costs, but still want an oceanfront property, this is your place. You can even hit the farmers' market on Lower Honoapiilani Road, past the Times supermarket. If you want to relax like a Kamaaina,

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Venice323
Reviews.Content: High rise condo complex that provides very nice views of the ocean. Booked a studio ocean view and the staff accommodated our request to stay on the highest (12th floor). But some of the details are lacking. The furniture in our room was dated, the utensils, cookware, and kitchen appliances were cheap. The washer leaked, the curtain rod was falling off, and the front door is worn and patched up with putty. Also, the AC is not the best and the room howls when it gets windy. And, for some reason, the walkway to the beach was blocked off with yellow caution tape. All-in-all, it's a good value if you want to stay in West Maui (my first time and learned, the hard way, that I much prefer South Maui and the Maui Hill in Kihei.) Finally, the staff is great and the place is spotless. Pool is cleaned every day and housekeeping washes the dishes. (Leaving a nice tip goes a long way and it's much appreciated.)

Reviews.Title: “Good for price - not greatest location”
Reviews.Author: paulbdallas
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this location - got a good travel deal package. I read the reviews and saw it was fairly well rated. My impressions were: 1) fair price for the accommodations, 2) good point to ask to see several units (I did not pick the one they had assigned to me - picked a unit with better appliances and furnishing - same view), 3) far from everything (highly recommend a car), and 4) some restaurants close by (which is a plus - but no easy grocery store). All in all - a fair price and nice clean accommodations. Not sure I recommend staying here again due to the location unless you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Place”
Reviews.Author: Matusla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in an ocean front room 1201 very nice view. When we checked in we were given the choice of three rooms to see which my daughter & wife would preferred. This is a high rise building composed of live-in units that include kitchenettes, large refrigerators, etc. Ours was a two bedroom-room, with pull-out and the unit was quite generous in size. Our room had a laundry with washer/dryer which was very handy for the six of us. There is free car parking (item to check out prior to booking) if required which was good as we rented a car for a seven days. The property is right on the beach and across the road from the Kahana Gateway shopping center which has a number of restaurants and coffee shop along with a general store at the gas station. Sands restaurant 1/4 mile away has and early dinner special of 50% off, my 18 year old grandson stated the portions were generous and tasted very good (short ribs mango). The pool area and ground was always kept clean. The reception staff were always helpful if asked for information. My son-in-law and expert at staying 5 star resorts was very complementary of the property and staff. So the money we saved here we used on outings in Mauia.

Reviews.Title: “High Rise Condotel with Views”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver1
Reviews.Content: This is a high rise building composed of live-in units that include kitchenettes, large refrigerators, etc. Ours was a one-room, but quite generous in size. Most rooms have some view of the ocean, due to the way the building is laid out, but on the south side your most direct view is of the neighboring high-rise. Wi-fi is not included, but available for about $30/week. "Lahaina" is a large area and this hotel is miles to the north of the core community of Lahaina, in a mostly low-rise and residential area. It's a bit slower and easier paced, but with the exception of an astronomically priced Roy's, a Maui Brewing Company, and a MacDonalds in walking distance, you will be driving to dinner and to other spots. The beach in front of this hotel is eroded to the point of being unusable. If you want to hang out on a wide beach, you'll need to drive somewhere. You can swim in the ocean here, depending on surf, etc., although the sign implies it is dangerous at all times. There is a nice little pool. The rooms are old style, reasonably well maintained, and quite satisfactory. We found the mornings a bit noisy, due to various maintenance activity in the adjoining courtyard areas. Overall, this was reasonably priced, generous in size, and the kitchen allows for avoiding some of the high food costs in Maui. You are however, in a high-rise, looking at other high-rises, with a peek ocean view. You have to decide if that is what you want. A better alternative, we discovered, would be the Outrigger at Napili, which is low rise and right near one of the nicest little beaches on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars, Good place to stay, great views”
Reviews.Author: SalandBrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in an ocean front room on the 10th floor. When we checked in we were given the choice of two rooms to see which view we preferred. The property is looking dated but had everything we wanted and was very clean. Our room had a laundry with washer/dryer which was very handy. There is free car parking if required which was good as we rented a car for a few days. The property is right on the beach and across the road from the Kahana Gateway shopping center which has a number of restaurants and coffee shop along with a general store at the gas station. There are free bbq facilities which were clean. The pool area was always clean. The reception staff were always helpful if asked for information.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sara A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean-front one-bedroom condo on the 7th floor. It wasn't overly fancy, but it was clean, quiet, updated and comfortable. We didn't use the pool, but we did swim in the ocean right off the beach outside the hotel. Our favorite thing was being able to leave the patio door open at night and let the sound of the ocean waves put us to sleep. After reading the mixed reviews on this place, we were pleasantly surprised. I felt that it was a good value and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. My only beef was that 2 of the 3 elevators were out of order. We ended up taking the stairs often because the wait was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times...”
Reviews.Author: smiley0669
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd trip to this island and stayed in different places. We chose this place because of location and price! Although the hotel is a bit outdated in furnitures, it was good enough for the purpose since we were not planning to stay in our room all day. Definitely need the 3rd elevator to work to help to get up and down because it is so slow esp. if you're in the 11th floor! This hotel is really great, convenient, close to a lot of places except for their front desk staff...they have no personality and are rude! No one except Tim greets you when you walk by or at least say "good morning/afternoon". Whoever is working that time seems to always stare at their computers or have their head down!!! They were so horrible that you don't even want to ask them for anything because they are not willing to give you information that you need. I have recommended this hotel to a few friends because of location and price but i definitely warned them of their front desk staff especially Afu! Also recommend to take the trip to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Sep. 15-22 at the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: insOma
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews, and finding this place on the list of "possibles" that I could use air miles for, I booked at week here with my small family (two adults, one 7-month old). It was pretty much what I expected from the reviews: average, no bells and whistles, but clean, quiet, functional and cheap-ish. We ended up booking a few activities with the Expedia desk in the lobby, and got a great deal on the Ulalena dinner and show package, which was a lot of fun. The Expedia people were cheerful and very helpful. I looked at 4 rooms before settling on 905, which was a step above the other rooms in terms of decor, a bathroom update, and the firmness of the mattress. I paid extra for the ocean view and it was totally worth it: waking up and looking out the window at the ocean is a great way to start the day, and even from the 9th floor we could hear the waves on the beach at night. We made good use of the washer/drier and the kitchenette, and ate breakfast daily on the lanai. We used one of the gas grills down by the pool once, no complaints. Free parking was a big plus. All in all we had no regrets about having stayed there, but next time will probably continue looking for the "perfect" spot. One thing I kind of didn't like was that the building is a high-rise, and doesn't have as intimate of a feel as some of the smaller, 2-story places where we've stayed before. The elevators were kind of a pain, and while we were there we had a few maintenance issues with our room (the ceiling fan stopped working!), but everything was resolved reasonably quickly. The beach is narrow and somewhat rocky, and theres not much to see snorkeling, as other people have noted, but it was great for our early morning and sunset walks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great view, could hear the waves.”
Reviews.Author: Midwestraveler53402
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from this great hotel. We were on our 8th trip to Hawaii in 10 years. We love the islands and this hotel (condo) was a great place to spend the nights. You need a car to see this island, get up at sunrise and be on your way. We drove 775 miles in a week, the cheapest and most effective way to see what you want, when you want. We ate at L & L Hawaiian Barbecue, our favorite many times. We hunt them up where ever we travel, a great meal for a good deal.We drove to Hana, did the north road and drove up the crater twice. Our condo was clean, everything better than expected. We had a garden view, but could see a large section of the ocean from our deck. House keeping was there everyday and did a great job. Other condos we have stayed in never cleaned or made the bed. We bought groceries at Safeway after getting a card at the service desk. Food is a bit expensive but good quality. Went to church at the Whaler's Village in a waterfront restaurant, a really neat experience. The pastor called this 8 AM service "The real Happy Hour", it was great, to sing the hymns of faith on the shore of the Pacific. The condo staff was very pleasant, I think some people that have such blistering reviews of staff must be themselves be angry people. Those who call this hotel a dump must have never had to work for themselves and their own money. We would return here again as soon as we see the grandkids and get over the 5 hour jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: yaymegs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Kahana during our honeymoon for 7 days in an ocean view studio. Upon check in the woman at the counter was very friendly & helpful. She even let us look at 3 different rooms and decide which one we liked best to stay in. The room we chose was a bit dated, but not as much as the 2 others we looked at. We loved having a washer/dryer available in the studio unit & utilized the kitchenette daily to cook breakfast and eat out on the lanai. We also used the Expedia "expert" located in the lobby to book a luau. The price was fair and she had a lot of great tips about Maui. The property was well maintained and clean, can't beat staying right on the ocean! The pool was a bit drab with a few lawn chairs set out, no jacuzzi. There are a few grills near the pool, which we utilized to grill a few steaks for dinner. The beach at the hotel seems a bit rocky for snorkeling, but great for laying out or enjoying a picnic. Also, just a few minutes drive away are the best white chocolate macadamia nut pancakes with coconut syrup! I would definitely recommend visiting the Gazebo restaurant and ordering these pancakes. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Royal Kahana and would stay again. You can't beat the price for an ocean front location!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Donielle R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, we stayed on the 6th floor and our room was a studio with a kitchen and laundry(which was a awesome to wash our clothes!) it was clean and the bed was very comfy. It wasn't anything fancy but it worked. We weren't there in the room half the time anyway because there is so much to do in Maui! The only thing that I did not like about our room was that the bathroom severely needed updated! The shower head was so disgusting and rusted and the tiles were moldy! And the sliding glass door was so annoying, the wind would howl through it all the time and it was hard to shut! Other than that it was a great place to stay! Great view of the ocean and the staff were really nice and we always had clean towels put in our room even though we didn't really need them every day. The room had silverware and dishes for us to use and dawn dish soap so we didn't have to buy our own. The pool was warm, and there is a grill to use but we didn't know that til the last night we were there. The beach was very rocky and not good for swimming but nice just to lounge. We even got to see a sea turtle swim right by us while we were in the water. AND FREE parking was a plus! Everywhere on Oahu charged for parking your car at the hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable place, very attentive staff, facility doesn't sparkle”
Reviews.Author: Jeff94114
Reviews.Content: My partner ,his teenagers and I stayed here July 27 through Aug 5. We rented adjoining condos. Furniture and decor was a la KMart 1980 but everything was functional. Stackable washer dryer worked. We used the kitchenette a lot and I was really pleased that the chambermaids actually washed our dishes. Location is very good, about 4 miles from Lahaina and close to Kapalua Beach with its protected cove, shallow water and ability to snorkel. there is a more open-water beach by the hotel and we'd swim there many evenings. Not sugar sand, but nice anyway with a good view of Lana'i. We got this package through Pleasant Holidays, package was about $6500 for 4 people including airfare and compact car rental. I think it was decent value for the money. There are lusher hotels up and down the coast but why waste lots of money for beautiful rugs and sofa sets; you're not there for the furnishings. There was nothing wrong with anything, e.g. pests, leaking, malfunction. It was just right.

Reviews.Title: “good place to chill out”
Reviews.Author: lassie79
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel very good. We had a studio room with ocean view which was worth the extra. It had a large balcony and the room had a lounge and dinning table as well as full kitchen. It was well cleaned and the beds extremely comfortable. The pool area was great having bbq's as well and we enjoyed our stay here. Perhaps a litlle isolated and you needed a car to get around the island. Free parking was provided. There was a block of shops close by to buy the essentials. The only thing missing was a bar and I felt the place needed something more to give it aholiday feel. There were however a couple of resorts a short walk away that provided good dinning and somewhere to go for a drink. breakfast was not included as an option, so you need to cater for yourself. On the whole a good hotel if you want a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel for a young family.”
Reviews.Author: Mods29
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in ground floor garden side room and couldn't have asked for a better spot. Our almost 2 yr old loved the open lawn area and we had a front row seat to watch the sunset from our lanai or the grass. The kitchen was perfect and we ate in every night which was a welcome change after 5 nights in Waikiki. Our Maui experience was wonderful and we'd love to come back. Special thanks to Peni from housekeeping who gave our son a wood carved turtle.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: mlchandler
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. Our balcony was over the pool with an ocean front view of Lanai. Only negative was the lack of beach goodies, ie. boogie boards, chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "Oceanfront" Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JackBag
Reviews.Content: We paid for a 1-bedroom oceanfront condo but did not get one. We had a better view of the adjoining resort than the ocean. It appears the only true oceanfront condos are the largeer 2-bedroom units. Its disappointing to fly all the way to Maui and not getr what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay at the Royal Kahana, it doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Luka302
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Royal Kahana for our third visit to Maui and stayed this time on the garden side, unit 906. The view on to Molokai and beyond was awesome. Having stayed our past two visits above the pool, we felt that the garden sides was a bit quieter. Our unit was outstanding and seemed to be recently renovated. The staff was welcoming and available. For the price (reasonable and competitive), the Royal Kahana is a good deal, without sacrificing anything. If you want West Maui for your place to stay, we'd recommend this property highly.

Reviews.Title: “So breezy you won't need the AC”
Reviews.Author: lambinator
Reviews.Content: This was our second time of staying here and have recomeded to friends. We enjoy the view that is (we were on the top floor ocean front). We love the crank open windows at the rear of the unit to create a wonderful relaxing all day and night cross breeze. The attendant at the front desk gave us the key to check out the room before we decided to check in. I would recomend asking to see the room before checking in we were givng two choices with a ocean front or ocean view and a slight difference in prices. It was up to date and clean. The kitchen althugh small, had everything we needed and then some. The washer and dryer was like new and at first we couldn't get the washer to work but we finally figured it out (operator error). The pool is kinda small but you do have the ocean. There is also clean bar bee ques by the pool you can use. The place was quite except for our last night, there was new guest checking into the room next to us and they were arguing very loudly, slaming dooors and what ever. But some one must have come up and told them to cool it because it got quite after that. There is no restauraunt on site and most of all the tourist activities are quite a drive away. This may be something to keep in mind with the price of gas as high as it is. My wife left a pair of prescription sunglasses in our room after we checked out and she called later that afternoon and was told to call housekeeping, they returned the call the following day and told her they didn't find them. So make sure you have everything before you check out.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: robkari
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Royal Kahana was referred to us by a friend that lived for many years on Maui and actually was the GM at the Hilton Resort in Kona, Big Island. Our room was dated and there were labels all over the place (probably 30-35) telling us what NOT to do! I.e. "Do not open windows", "oven for light cooking only", "do not move lamps", "do not open master bedroom sliding door", "a/c shuts off if windows are open", "don't push chair in too close to table", etc... It was brutal! Beach access isn't good and you really need to go down to Ka'anapalii beach to get into good sand, and Whaler's Market or Lahaina for shopping and commercial eats. Worst thing is that we left behind a hair curling iron and a straightening iron under the sink accidentally and upon calling once we returned home, were told we needed to talk to the housekeeping manager to see if they found it. When calling the HK Mgr, we were told they didn't see it and that we'd have to file a police report! Out $200, and asked to call the police...awful and the resort manager offered no help, just hid behind housekeeping. Best part about staying at the Royal Kahana is that there is a small restaurant within walking distance called "Black Angus" (not the chain...) that has amazing food, awesome drink specials and phenominal personalized service (especially if you get to be served by Robert Ponce, a Hawaii native and amazing ambassador). They serve sushi, poke, and steak. truly a diamond in the rough and a terrific value. Better experiences and values are nearby...

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved Royal Kahana!”
Reviews.Author: leighrjones
Reviews.Content: The Royal Kahana is right on a gorgeous beach with beautiful view from the pool and a near 360 degree view from the condo we stayed in (1020). Outrigger was great in all respects. We booked our stay directly with them and were impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. The condo was clean and comfortable. Nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it ... best location in Maui... out of the world !”
Reviews.Author: Aanch
Reviews.Content: There cannot be a place better than Royal Kahanna.. their location was right next to the ocean... since we visited in Feb could see hump back whales from our balcony.. Hotel rooms are gorgeous.. so well maintained... neat & with all amenities. U feel like living in a different world... soo peaceful & calm.. we spent our 1st anniv in Maui & Royal Kahanna added to our celebration .. dont even think twice about staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Comes Through Once Again”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAZWildcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an Outrigger facility on a previous trip to the Big Island and were impressed enough to try again at Maui's Royal Kahana. This second visit left us completely convinced that Outrigger facilities are a sure bet for the undecided. Royal Kahana was beautiful, convenient, friendly, and fun. We were a group of six, and all had an excellent experience. The parking was ample, free, and close to the lobby. The staff was the friendliest we have ever had in Hawaii (and we've not had a bad experience yet in four recent trips). The grounds were well-maintained, right on the beach, lively, yet peaceful and quiet. The BBQ grills at poolside set the pace for great evening time fun and food. The swimming pool was clean and just a bit warmer than the ocean, making it a pleasant water transition from the ocean. Of course, they have an outdoor shower in between the beach and pool for rinsing sand off your feet and body! The elevators were FAST--no waiting around. We stayed on the 10th floor at oceanfront--really impressive room, beds, kitchen, and patio--what a remarkable view of Molokai and Lanai. At night, you can just make out the lights on the far west ocean horizon as Honolulu. The entire stay was absolutely perfect. Outrigger Royal Kahana is an upscale way to stay at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CCWhippet
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet area in Kahana, Maui, HI. Pool side of condos has great views and quieter. Very clean property. I rented a one bedroom and it was very spacious, nice kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: tjeab1logan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both originally from Hawaii (Oahu) and haven't been back to the Islands in over 20 years, never together, and never to Maui. This was our 20th wedding anniversary treat to ourselves. We booked through Costo based on photo's we saw and felt that this would be a beautiful place to stay. We upgraded to an "ocean view". Upon arrival the hotel clerk was extrememly rude, definitely not "Island hospitality" I remember. Generally, all front desk clerks were rude but one. Our room was 1118, very out dated, but clean. The kitchen had only one working outlet. The bathroom tub was...ugh! The side wall of the tub was covered with plaster (you could tell, there must be dry rot under there). I'm not kidding when I say this...hot water was rare. You would literally have to run the water for over 20 minutes to get hot water. Then during your shower the hot water was there one minute, gone the next. The bed was lumpy, but tolerable. As for our ocean view, yes you could see the ocean if you stood to the left of the patio. Room cleaning, was a poor. It was as if they just made the bed and replaced the towels. Never new coffee or even cleaned the dishes. On day 3 we placed a do not desturb sign, as I felt more competent to do their job. Our paper work from the hotel stated that if there were any problems with the room to contact your agent not hotel staff. This was our 2nd honeymoon, we mostly spent time in the room to shower and sleep, so we just dealt. Nice to have a working washer/dryer. Parking was never a problem. The beach is right off the grounds, but with coral, so if you have sensitive feet...beware. Never used the pool...come on, it's Hawaii...beach! Sunsets were beautiful all along Maui. The woman at the activity desk, was limited in her recommendations and pushed listening to timeshare. I'm sorry to say, we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KBak
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Royal Kahana. My husband & I had never been to Hawaii, and after travelling all over Maui the week we were there, we were so happy to be in Kahana at the Outrigger Royal Kahana. The property is just perfect for people who like to keep it simple. We enjoyed that the parking was free and the room was lovely. We went snorkeling right outside every morning and then came back for breakfast on our balcony overlooking the pool, garden and ocean. We even enjoyed grilling steaks outside and having our anniversary dinner our last night by the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lynmore58
Reviews.Content: Booked on-line not knowing anything about the property or this part of Maui. Stayed in Room 1120 - absolutely great! Although the property is older our apartment was refurbished and had every amenity we needed. The pool area was well maintained as were all common areas. A short walk to a general store, Macdonalds, restaurants etc although I would recommend a rental car so you can enjoy everything Lahaini has to offer. Staff were friendly and helpful. All in all a property we would revisit and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beward”
Reviews.Author: plh333
Reviews.Content: We booked our arrangements through a travel agent and told her that we definitely wanted to spend the additional money for an oceanfront room. In her info, it offered a 1 bedroom oceanfront suite. So we booked that. Interesting that I see in another review someone had room 708 as an ocean view and we in 308 was called oceanfront??? While the suite was comfortable, it CLEARLY WAS NOT AN OCEAN FRONT ROOM! We have since written to ask for the difference in price and get this...The definition, for them, of an oceanfront room is one where you can see the ocean from your front door. What is up with that??? Anyone that travels and books OCEAN FRONT expects an unimpeded view of the ocean. Our view was blocked by balcony walls and a building next door. Am not a fan of this place and if you want OCEAN FRONT...be sure you know you won't get it with a one bedroom suite. It clearly is on the side of the building! Very disappointing. Finally, we too arrived at the resort only about an hour early, and was told to come back, go shopping or something. I highly doubt our room was not ready.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been a disaster- but it worked fine”
Reviews.Author: cazaresil
Reviews.Content: We booked a Costco package for 2 adults and 2 children. When we arrived at the hotel, we were offered a terrible bedroom with 1 queen bed and one twin. Imagine a motel bedroom with a little kitchen against the wall that it shares with a stinky bathroom. But more importantly, how were we supposed to fit there? So we started our Maui vacation with a tough discussion with the hotel management and Costco. The hotel manager offered us the option to add a rollerway bed at $20 extra per day but also told us that that would be against the fire code! Option two, pay $65 more per day ($45 for the upgrade and $20 for the rollerway bed) and get a nicer room with a king, a queen sofabed and a rollerway bed. No fire code violations this time. We moved to the better room to the risk of having to pay the "upgrade" by ourselves. A few days later, Costco told us that they had talked to the hotel and that they had figured out that there was a glitch in the system. The hotel was expecting 3 people, not 4. The hotel accepted to give us a complementary update, so we only paid the $20 extra for the rollerway bed. What really bothers me of this hotel is that they saw our paperwork with a reservation for 2 adults and 2 children and did nothing about it. That when you are checking in after a long trip with 2 children and expecting the vacation of a lifetime... Besides, we were offered a solution that was against the fire code. But, at the end of things, we must say that the stay was enjoyable. The better bedroom was a good deal for Maui and everybody slept really well. We had a nice ocean view that allowed us to see whales from the balcony. The hotel is very close to at least 5 great beaches and has an okay swimming pool, so our kids had a great time. Remember that you get what you pay for... this is not a hotel, and most nights there is only one staff in the entire building. So don't call the reception in the night to ask for something that it's not really urgent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo”
Reviews.Author: LwnSeattle
Reviews.Content: Found this location and booked through Costco travel. It was perfect - right on the beach, beautiful and roomy 1 bedroom condo with all the amenities. Location was good for activities out of Lahaina or Maalea - not a huge beach but decent. Expedia desk in lobby was very helpful and saved us $ on activities. It also had free parking which is rare.

Reviews.Title: “What a location to survive a tsunami”
Reviews.Author: jrocjo
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and we specifically asked Kay Ryan, our travel agent at --, to reserve us a condo at the Royal Kahana. Kay suggested we reserve a one bedroom with an ocean view for the extra space and view of the ocean. We agreed, when we checked in were given room 708. What a pick, the view, amenities, and the "feeling at home" we got when we entered the condo tells it all. We could not have been more pleased and told Kay that we would like the same arrangements for our next trip. Having the fully equipped kitchen and washer and dryer made our stay just a little bit easier. The views of the ocean, turtles and whales ended each day after taking in the many Maui activites. The final touch to our visit was the tsunami. Fun to tell friends we were there for it, but happy about the little damage done to the islands.

Reviews.Title: “So what the complex is a little dated!”
Reviews.Author: str8-trippin
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the other reviews criticizing the service and the property and I was prepared to disappointed. The facts are: 1. The property is aged, likely built in the '70s. 2. The staff was not overwhelming with smiles; they were not tripping over themselves to impress us. 3. The decor was not best I've seen. HOWEVER, I wasn't expecting the Westin, Hyatt, Hilton or Four Seasons amenities and over the top phony customer service because I had paid a lot of money to stay there. I went to Maui with my wife, our 3 kids and our neice. We had 2 rooms(studio and 1 bedroom) at the cost of my wife and I would've paid for just one studio at one of the "higher end" resort properties. News flash, we didn't go to Hawaii to stay in the room and admire the decor! Our rooms were cleaned daily, we had a stackable washer/dryer each room and complimentary laundry detergent, so we didn't go home with a weeks worth of dirty laundry and we weren't frustrated by the outrageous cost of our clothes cleaned by the hotel staff. Fresh beach towels were provided multiple times of the day at any time we requested. The staff were warm, sincere and genuine not fake and rehearsed like we've experienced at some of the resort properties we've visited. Expedia provided concierge services onsite 7 days per week and they were very helpful in arranging snorkeling, luau, whale watching and zip-lining trips. Did I mention I played Ka'anapli golf course twice? in our 8 day stay? If my wife and I were looking to get away and be spoiled and LIKELY never leave the resort, this is not the place we'd stay. If you want to save a little money so you can experience Hawaii, its history, the people and have enough cash left over to do everything you can think of, then the Royal Kahana is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: Cathycor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 weeks at the Royal Kahaha. We wondered if 3 weeks would be too long, but I could have easily stayed another 3 weeks. Fabulous ocean view from our third floor unit. Plenty of space for two people for an extended stay. Loved the big closet! Never used the air conditioning, just opened the jalousie windows at the back and let the breeze come through. We were close enough to drive to Lahaina, restaurants, etc., but I felt we really needed to have a car. Kitchen was adequately equipped. Great to have a washer and dryer, iron and ironing board in the unit. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Great value. I'd stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Perfect Stay at the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: Schmitt663
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the third time at the Royal Kahana and again we were NOT dissappointed. This is our home away from home when we come to Maui. The hotel has a great location and is easy to find. We just enjoy the place so much that we won't even consider another property! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for watching whales,dolphins,sea turtles sunsets and tsunamis..”
Reviews.Author: johnnybgood1
Reviews.Content: Makes sure you get a room on the southeast side high up and to your liking,We had an excellent stay of 10 days . Great staff,very clean place with plenty of free parking. Kahana Sands 2 doors down the beach. $3.95 breakfast,$3 Myties, and $5 Happy hour appetizers are exceptional...Gazebo and Sea House (Happy Hour)restaurants on Napili Bay a mile north are rated in top 5 for Maui...Whale Spoutings every day from your Lanai with gorgeous sunsets. Did the Lahaina Snorkel Cruise to Molokini Crater and the Turtle Reef,More fun swimming with the turtles than you can believe.Spent the Tsunami night watching the water surge and recede over and over again, .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit -- I'd go back, but ...”
Reviews.Author: AK_Steve_AK
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Royal Kahana. It started out nicely with an upgrade from a studio to a very large one bedroom on the 12th floor. It turns out the 12th floor was a great place to be for the tsunami that emanated from the Japan earthquake. I was up almost all night watching the water recede and roll back-in, many times. I was disappointed that the hotel seemed to make no effort to contact every resident and let us know about the tsunami warning and what to do (though the blaring tsunami sirens made it obvious that something was going on). I liked the informal nature of the hotel ... no bellman ... self-park ... free parking ... nice barbecues ..., etc. No resort fee. An unpretentious place. Close to McDonalds. There is an internet fee, but the internet was very good and fast. Full kitchen, TV, bathroom, bed, lots of closets ... everything was great. I think this may differ from room to room since it is a condo hotel and my understanding is that each is individually owned.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view from lanai, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieM1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit 916, which is managed by an off-site agency, Chase N'Rainbows. We got off to a rocky start when we arrived after hours and they forgot to put our key in the lock box as agreed, but they sent someone right out to take care of it! Unit 916 needs upgrading; it's old and tired at this writing. However, the location is great and we couldn't stay off the lanai. Just gorgeous. However, I think the owner banks on that too much, and they really need to put some money back in the unit itself. The front door is oil stained, all the fixtures were grungy. The Royal Kahana's hallways are grungy; carpet stained, but everything else was nice. The pool is over-heated, and everyone one night dubbed it the hotel's hot tub. Great basement parking, nice bbq areas, good beach right there. Bring reef shoes. We would stay here again, but would be apt to try other units or neighboring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great balcony with whales, sea turtles, and magnificent scenery makes you not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: BrenAndTerry
Reviews.Content: Even if you travel 15 min to Front St. in Lahaina, it is a beautiful drive. So much to see and do all along the west shore. Recommend room 310. 2 separate beautiful bedrooms and 3 beautiful bathrooms. Trilogy boat ride was our favorite thing besides relaxing on the balcony enjoying the ocean. Maui less busy and more serene than Honolulu. Next time will only go to Maui and stay longer than a week. We are in our 40's and early 50's. Hotel was mostly people our age and a bit quieter which we wanted. Premises were clean and convenient for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding ocean experience”
Reviews.Author: 2011hawaiiTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in room 810. The condo was just over 1,200 sq feet, 3 bathrooms... 2 bedrooms, great accomodations for our group of 5. We enjoyed breakfast while watching the whales. Enjoyed a day trip over to the island of Lanai. I highly recommend this for travelers that enjoy an apartment type of vacation property. The pool is not a big resort pool.. but it is heated and great for a morning swim. We enjoyed walking on the beach and watching the sea turtles right by the shore line. We feel asleep to the sound of the ocean everynight. so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but not much to do close by.”
Reviews.Author: RichC001
Reviews.Content: Not much to find fault with this hotel. The room was comfortable and reasonably well equipped. The kitchenette did lack any worktop space for food preparation. There weren't too many other places nearby to eat without driving. The pool was small but the water was very warm. Right behind the pool area was the sea. The beach was sandy, but as soon as you got in the water it was shallow and rocky. It was often too shallow to swim so grazed knees and banged feet and toes were common as the water was too sandy to see the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay of a property that needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: BluejayCamas_Wa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, but found that many of the units need updating. The property has a great location, good parking, nice grounds and most units have wonderful views. However, some have not been updated in many years. Our unit had old furnishings and old dusty wall hangings and fake plastic floral arangements. The cooking utensils were also quite sparse. The staff was helpful, though some what standoffish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Average Condiminium complex”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyMike32973
Reviews.Content: We stayed in RM 806 a one bedroom condo February 9th thru 16th. What was good: -Ourstanding housekeeping. Clean condo and friendly staff -Good bed. -Location-Right on the ocean with a great view. We watched the turtles and whales play all day from the Lanai. -Great grass area along the ocean for lounging -Very quiet -Price seemed competitve -Expedia Rep in the Lobby What was so so: -Condo was a little dated but is was reasonably stocked with dishes, cookware etc -Pool was ok but not enough lounge chairs -Exercise Room -Air Conditioning What was bad -Front Desk personnel were big duds. No energy, no smiles and the simplist request seemed like a burden. They should take customer service lessons from the Housekeeping staff. -Internet Connection and their technical support. Never did get connected. I travel often for both business and pleasure and this is the first time I could not get connected in my room even though they advertise availablilty. The fee is a little high. Hint. If you have a laptop the McDonalds across the street has free internet service.and is reasonably fast. -Computers in the lobby-Fee is high. In addition to the computer time they also charge $.75 per printed page. -Managers reception. No manager. Just one guy pouring juice and a bowl of potato chips that you put in a plastic glass. It did provide a giggle-but why have it. Would we stay again. Yes if we could get a similarly located condo. The price was competitive, the location good and the view outstanding. There is a great place for breakfast. It is called the Gazebo. It is 2 miles north on Lower Honoapiilani Rd (mile marker 30) right on the beach at another condo complex. However get there early or be prepared to wait. They open at 7:30am. We got there at 7am and were third in line. When we finished our breakfast there were ~20 people in line and from what we were told there is a line all day. They are open until 2pm. Great food, great view and great service with a smile. Well worth the wait. Not a good place for groups more than 4 unless you want to split up. Small place with no large tables.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Joe51697
Reviews.Content: The Royal Kahana was a great place to stay during my visit to Maui. The surroundings, beach, pool, and common areas were all very pleasant. And the room was so comfortable, with a great view of the sea against a background of the neighboring island (Molakai). It was of great interest to sit on the lanai (balcony) and watch the whales surface. And the sound of the surf was really soothing as I drifted off to sleep. Added to this, the cost was quite reasonable. All in all, I would recommend the Royal Kahana as a base when visiting Maui. It was a wonderful experience. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Partial Ocean View Studio”
Reviews.Author: SRK3003
Reviews.Content: We were on the sixth floor with great views, saw whales right from our beds. The beach and pool was located right outside the lobby. Nice gardens. The full kitchen was fully stocked with utensils, plates, pots,and baking pans. Alll utensils including the wine bottle opener. Nice table and chairs. Beds confortable. The only thing missing was a couch or soft chairs to sit on while watching tv. Computers and printer availabe to use for a fee. (.20 min, .75per sheet printed, $5 min usage).

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mamapeeps
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Royal Kahana and found it to be a really nice place. The room we had (#405) had new carpeting, a very comfortable bed and nice lanai. We kept the door to the lanai open all the time we were in the room and turned off the a/c; there's a ceiling fan located in the center which to us kept the room at a great temperature. Listening to the ocean all night was soothing. The kitchen cabinets are older, but well maintained. The washer and dryer in the room was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping came in every day and made the bed and put out new linens if you wanted them; or you could hang up your towels and they were replaced every couple of days. The nearby restaurants were great. The road back to Lahaina or Kaanapali was recently widened making travel back and forth easy. We would definitely stay there again. We booked everything thru Delta.com and were very pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: “A great value, great location but some rooms are better than others.”
Reviews.Author: Blackstonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six days on the 2nd floor in a garden apartment but we could still see the incredible sunsets. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare our own meals and there are a number of gas grills around the pool area. The beach is eroded but there's still enough of it for a nice walk and there was plenty of space for sunset viewing. It's clean and well maintained but this is not a spanking brand new hotel but it's kept up very nicely. Our room had a very hard king sized bed but our neighbors had a deluxe pillow top so if you don't like your room just ask for a different one. A new full sized refrigerator, microwave and 20" electric range and disposal made it like a small apartment and it's very secure but laid back and informal. The cupboards are stocked with a toaster and blender and dishes and glassed and cups and coffee maker and utensils. The staff is very friendly. The washer and dryer in our room was a life saver because I did not have to pack a lot of clothing and there's convenient shopping at the 24 hour grocery & gas just a few hundred feet up the road. Lots of affordable places to eat within walking distance but we rented a car at the airport. The car of choice is a Mustang convertible, they were everywhere in every color. The main strip in Lahaina was a great place to hang out during the day. There's an outdoor pool and a fitness center with sauna in the basement. It's a little noisy in the morning because of the traffic but it gets quieter as the day goes on. Six days is not long enough to appreciate everything the Royal Kahana has to offer. A boom box would have been very nice but there was a TV. No complaints except for that hard mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: shannylg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Royal Kahana for 10 nights. We have stayed here before and were very disappointed when we arrived and the beach has been "washed away." A big part of a hotel in Maui is having a beach to watch the sunset from!!! We had a room on the ground level and after a big rain storm overnight, noticed the carpet was all wet at the sliding door. We notified the front desk and nothing was done. We used towels to soak it up ourselves since nobody seemed concerned. 2 days later when it began to smell, we returned late with our sliding door completely open to dry out the carpet and our room unsecured (on the ground level) allowing anyone walking around the grounds to see in and walk in our room. The day we left the room smelled horribly. We knew the rooms were dated, but it just felt old and dirty. The tub was rusty and the tile looked dirty. We will not be returning to the Royal Kahana. We have also stayed at the Royal Lahaina, which is costs a little more and does not have a kitchen but is MUCH nicer and an awesome beach. Well worth the extra money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NdOutlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana and couldn't have been happier. We stayed in room 1211, a 2 bedrm oceanfront top floor condo. Outstanding view, very clean and spacious, comfortable beds. Good restaurants across from hotel and an excellent one a block south on another property called the Sands of Kahana. 1/2 price entrees from 4-6. Fleming Beach, Honolua Bay, Mile marker 14, and helicopter ride were the highlights. Whale and turtle watching from balcony. Front desk service was excellent. Won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Well Maintained Older Building”
Reviews.Author: ztheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 11 days at the Royal Kahana for our Christmas Holiday. We felt it was a well maintained, older building. You can rent individual units from owners on HomeAway or from the Royal Kahana direct. We rented an updated, 1 bedroom unit on the 8th floor from a private owner on HomeAway that was wonderful! It was very clean with new carpet & furniture, a very comfortable king bed, 2 flat screen TV's and a well equipped kitchen. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the whales, turtles, para-sailers & paddle boarders. It was an awesome view from that height! We were on the right side of the building as you enter the lobby. Our balcony faced NW and did not get the direct sun, which we really liked, so we were able to sit out & enjoy it at all times of the day. Balcony's on the left side of the building got the sun and overlooked the pool. There was plenty of free parking in the open lot or underground. There is Internet access in the building but we had to purchase it (daily, weekly, or monthly) from SkyWave with a credit card in the unit we were in. There is a pool for the building & outdoor gas grills & an exercise room, but no hot tub. Over the Holidays, the pool was filled with children making it difficult for adults to use. There is an outdoor grassy area along the waterfront with plenty of lawn chairs for sunning. The beach access appears to be affected by recent erosion that washed away the steps. Those brave enough to cross the yellow caution tape, were able to walk a short distant on a somewhat rocky beach. Several people were snorkeling in front of the building. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent condo to stay at Maui”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Worked the PGA event from 12/31/10 - 01/09/11 and needed a hotel close to The Plantation Golf Resort @ Kapalua and this condo was only about 10 minutes away. There is a good selection of restaurants across the street from the condos (Black Angus, Brewing Co, McDonald's, Dollies Pub, etc.) The Lahaina Mall is about ten minutes away (the opposite direction from Kapalua) where many restaurants are located. Stayed at room 804 which included a partial view of the ocean and at all hours night and day you could hear the ocean (close the sliding door if you want some silence). The TV is old style TV but that's great since there are a ton of channels available and you can channel surf quickly (unlike flat screen TVs). Wifi is available but I didn't take advantage of that option. Cleaning staff did a fantastic job of cleaning the entire property (room, towels, pool, etc.) even though the building seems to be older. Furniture in the room was fairly old but I certainly didn't mind. Kitchen had all essentials and allows you to grocery shop and save money instead of eating out. Highly recommended. See attached photos (which included a double rainbow).

Reviews.Title: “Solid Three Star Quality...”
Reviews.Author: ead_angel
Reviews.Content: We booked this property knowing it was three-star but you always hope to be presently surprised! We had a garden view room, unit 218. It was very clean and well maintained, but the furniture and decor was outdated. The fridge and microwave were both relatively new. The kitchen was very well-stocked and had everything we needed to make breakfast and sandwiches. Housekeeping was outstanding and washed any dirty dishes we had left each day. Our biggest complaint was with the bed and mattress. The mattress seemed quite old and we both sagged into it uncomfortably. It also made a lot of noise if you rolled over, with the bed frame banging against the wall and headboard. There isn't much beach here, they are trying to prevent erosion. If you make a five minute walk you'll get to an area with sand if that is what you are looking for. We did enjoy watching sea turtles off the shore though one evening at sunset! There are several restaurants and stores within walking distance, but the property is on the far outskirt of Lahaina. It was fine for me, but my husband said he would prefer a different location closer to more restaurants if we went back. He also though this property cost too much for what it was. All in all, the room suited our needs - we were gone all day everyday sightseeing anyway... - but we were happy to leave for Big Island where we knew our room was newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: KimTheWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation package through Costco and were somewhat mislead as to what type of room we were going to stay in. Friends recommended staying at a condo because eating out at restaurants adds up quick and we wanted to make a few meals in our room. We upgraded from a standard garden-view to an ocean-view studio room. We thought the kitchenette was separated from where the bed was; however, it takes up one entire wall of the room. The furniture was outdated and based on the hotel pictures; we thought the furniture would be more modern. Our linen had a dirty spot on it but we checked in so late and we did not feel like calling down and dealing with moving to a different room after such a long day of traveling. We were disappointed the property didnâ€™t have a restaurant or bar on site, but there were many restaurants in walking distance â€“ I guess we should have thoroughly read reviews prior to booking, but excitement clouded our vision. The room had all of the amenities we needed including a washer and dryer. I used the fitness room once and it is in the basement! Room keys do not give you access to the fitness room so I had to go back up to the reservation desk and exchange my room key for a fitness room key along with sign a liability waiver. We used the outside barbeque pit one night and they were clean and ready to use. Overall, the experience was good but we would probably stay at a condo closer to Lahaina as this was a little drive north (Kahana) of where a lot more restaurants were.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump.”
Reviews.Author: SledMan
Reviews.Content: What a let down this place was compared to the Outrigger property where we stayed earlier in Honolulu, and from where we stayed previously on Maui, in Kaanapali. The first room in which we stayed here was #402. It was old, the fixtures were old, the place smelled of stale "human" odor, old sweat, and cleaning solution. The bathroom floor and shower curtain had human hair - not our own - left over from prior "guests". The wooden kitchen cabinets and drawers in the kitchenette were worn and sticky. The drawers squeaked on their runners. The lanai carpet had numerous cigarette and water stains. After calling "UNpleasant Hawaiian Holidays", we were able to switch to a slightly more modern and cleaner room the next day. Still, this property is tired and dumpy. The elevators are slow and noisy. Most of the painted surfaces on the property (railings, door jambs, etc) are chipped, rusty, or both. THERE IS NO BEACH ACCESS AS OF DECEMBER 2010. Apparently retaining walls and steps to the beach were washed away in a recent storm, and "Caution" tape now blocks access to the tiny and rocky non-beach. The front desk service is as bad as the rest of the place. The staff are slow to respond, and rather cavalier. One gentlemen behind the counter didn't bother to stand when addressing my wife and I as we asked him questions. He sat down, and propped his feet upon an adjacent chair, as if he were lounging in his living room. THIS IS THE WORST PLACE WE'VE STAYED IN A LONG TIME ANYWHERE. AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS! Housekeeping is sketchy, at best. (Yes, we understand what "lite" housekeeping is, but here the staff seems to take "Island Time" to a whole new and bad level). AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. I was underimpressed with Kahana as a whole, and this Outhouse Rigger property in particular. Go to the southern part of Maui if you want beaches. Even Kaanapali is far far far better. Oh, and as for parking, if you drive a Gem car, Mini-Cooper, or a scooter, you'll be fine. If you drive anything of standard width, good luck, these are the narrowist parking spaces I've ever seen, no kidding! AVOID THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger royal Kahana was everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: barbsoluri
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights, the room was large, the view was fantastic. I loved the washer & dryer. I used the barbecue twice and it was spotless each time. We ate at a fantastic restaurant called Canoes its at the beginning of Main street, can't beat the price, service and plenty of parking. We also splurged and ate at Mama's fish house, best seafood on the island. Food costs are high where ever you go, so pick your restaurants wisely. We rented a car from Hertz and drove up country till we reached a one lane road, don't go any further than that (insurance won't cover if you get into an accident or break down) The Hotel is only minutes from Whalers Village (over priced and cost $2.00 for half an hour parking) Only minutes from Lahaina and only free parking is at the end of Main Street but you can only park there 3 hrs. The hotel underground parking was great and close to the elevator. The beach is not a swimmers beach, small with lots of rocks. the pool is large and spotless just like the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Maui trip”
Reviews.Author: Bristol62
Reviews.Content: We have just stay at the Royal Kahana and had a fabulous time on the island. The room was spacious and the facilities available in the room was good, loved having the use of the washer/dryer very useful. The bed was large and very comfy. The front drive was being resurficed while we were there which was a very nosiy start to the morning but didn't disrupt us too much. The only downful to the hotel was as we did not have the use of a car you were isolated in the position of local facilities available. Just round the corner was a couple of restaurants which we found expensive, there was alway MacDonals. There was also a bar which served a local brewery's beer which we enjoyed. You needed to get a bus or taxi to anywhere else and the bus only ran once an hour and to get to Lahaina you need to connect with another bus and they stopped at around 8pm. The rooms offered kitchen facilites and use of barbi's near the pools which helped with the saving of money on self catering. The staff were friendly and Daisy May was very helpful with the booking of our chosen trips and connected us with a really usefull taxi firm which obviously cost us over the week due to not having a car.
