The taxi from the airport cost us $100 and would have been cheaper if we had contacted the hotel to get a number of the local taxi firm Daisy's taxis which were a husband and wife team who were fantastic and so helpfull and friendly. The view from the room was lovely and the hotel was right on the beach. The whales are not around until the beginning of the year when we were under the impression from advertising they were around during November. We did see the turtles on the beach in the evening and the sunsets were amazing. Overall the hotel gave us what we needed for our stay and helped us enjoy a remarkable visit to Maui. We did a helicopter trip and a road trip back along the Hana Road which was absolutely amazing and well worth the expense. We had planned to spend out a helicopter trip before we went but the road trip was an extra bonus and cheaper that doing the two separate as the Hana road trip was an all day road trip on its own. The pool was good and had no problem sitting around it during the day. There was no free wifi but did manage to piggy back off another free one if sat on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “The best there is on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: SGW66
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research on various websites, google maps and numerous reviews we booked our weeks vacation on Maui at the Outrigger Royal Kahana and it turned out to be the best decision I could have ever made. The one bedroom suite was on the fifth floor with an amazing ocean view. The kitchen was fully equipped with new appliances and top of the line stainless cookware, flatware and china, as well as non stick frying pans, every utensil needed and storage containers. The bed is the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever had the pleasure to sleep on and was furnished with 4 feather pillows and 4 foam pillows and extra blankets in the huge walk thru closet. The living room was huge and furnished in contemporary Hawaiian style and very tastefully decorated. A nice touch in the dining area were slat type transom windows along the ceiling that when opened along with the huge sliding glass door created a wonderful breeze through the condo. Everyday the cleaning staff came through and to my complete surprise, they even did the dishes! The washer and dryer worked perfect for us and next to them was a floor to ceiling pantry cabinet. The people at the front desk were very pleasant and polite, answered every dumb tourist question I had with a smile and were very helpful. The nicest thing for us was the concierge, an amazing woman named Heather. She gave us the information on every possible activity there was, booked the ones we wanted and even made last minute changes for us when after a day of snorkeling between Molokini and Lanai we found out my girlfriend get terribly seasick. Heather was our saving grace, without her we wouldn't have had a very good time at all. I can't possibly say enough good things about this hotel, it's placement on the island or it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option, Comfortable stay, clean property”
Reviews.Author: beachfinder2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio type room. Unit 1005 was clean and well maintained although the bathroom was a bit worn. This unit had a great view out to the beach and up the coast towards Napili. The room has a nice lanai with a table and 4 chairs. The kitchen had newer coffee maker and microwave. The kitchen was equipped with most common utensils, dishes and some handy pastic containers. Pool facilities were good but the sauna appears to have been out of order for some time. We used the gas grills at the pool 4 times and saved a tonne on restaurant meals...we were able to dine oceanside at sunset...tiki torches were lit around the property at dusk. This property is older but generally in good condition. A good option if you you are looking for a lower priced facility. Desk staff were helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even book a room with a coupon - no response!”
Reviews.Author: akknot
Reviews.Content: I have a coupon for "50% off the regular rack room rate or best available rate." I called the Outrigger reservation line and the reservation agent argued with me about the coupon I had and said that I couldn't use it on the published price on the internet, so I went online and filled out a "contact us" form asking for a manager to contact me, one week later, no response from the hotel. First a rude reservation agent then no response form the hotel when I requested to be contacted to book a room. I worked in the hotel industry for several years and I firmly believe you should not have to ask repeatedly to get a reservation or to have a manager contact you. So I booked through Aston and will enjoy my Hawaii vacation and give my money to Aston hotels since they were actually friendly and helpful. Many of my friends and co-workers go to Hawaii every year and I have been telling them to avoid Outrigger for their lack of service and rude reservation agents.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: bluestar68
Reviews.Content: We had a studio on the 4th floor way in the back on the side facing south. We were there three nights and two full days. The front desk staff was not friendly at all. We are fairly quiet people and don't expect anyone to chat us up but a hello smile and welcome would have set a better tone. I had called the front desk prior to booking the place to ask if Internet was available and the only answer I got was "yes". She didn't say that there was a charge or what the charge per day was so I was surprised to arrive at the condo to find that it was not free. The room was very outdated as was the kitchen. The oven was ancient and took a while to heat up. The rest of the kitchen equipment wasn't much better. The refrigerator was old and noisy and it was hard to sleep with it cycling on and off during the night. The view of the ocean was ok from the lanai and we enjoyed the sunset. It probably would have been better on a higher floor and closer to the beach. The bathroom had louver type glass windows which are not sound proof. There was a noisy family two units up from us. They were arguing loudly and we could hear every word of it from our condo. If you're a beach person, this is not the place to stay even though the building is ocean front. All the rules posted in the unit about the air conditioner automatically shutting down if we opened the sliding glass doors just didn't seem respectful or friendly. ( the sliding glass doors were not wired to the airconditioner controls at all) The one thing we did appreciate is the washer and dryer. Maui is a beautiful island but we would not stay at the Royal Kahana again. It was most definitely not worth what we paid for it. We were fortunate not to have booked a whole week here and were glad to be on our way to Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaconH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a few days with an Ocean View room. The staff was friendly and professional. They had a guy from Expedia to offer trips which was great. The Condo\Hotel was clean and elegant and a good value for the money. The unit I stayed in had a refrigerator, washer and Dryer, dish washer, very nice bathroom, and awesome views! No complaints. I would go back to this same room in a heartbeat! The only thing I wish they had was free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: We were in room 209. This was an oceanfront. This was the most relaxing vacation I have had in Maui in my 3 visits. This room is privately owened and rented through kahanacondodotcom. The amenities include a/c (although not the coolest a/c I ever used.), fully stocked kitchen, 2 tv's, pull out couch, free parking, free wi-fi and even use of the computer in room. I would definately go here again

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Not Lost but Found”
Reviews.Author: LJB049
Reviews.Content: I got in very late 10:00 pm local time, but the girl at the desk had everything ready for us, and when I ask about an upgrade in our room she took care of it on the spot. We ended up with a nice view of Lana'i and Moloka'i. Since this is a Condo the roooms are upgraded by their owners,ours could have used a little touching up but everything was in working order and clean. If you get tired of eating out you can cook in the room or they have 4 Webber gas grills, with grocery stores nearby. The Staff keeps the rooms the grounds and the pool well kept, and with a 1/2 mile of beach to walk right out front, this is a nice place to relax. if you rent a car there is no parking fee added on, which can be as high as $15 per day at other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: jenpeel63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay at the Royal Kahana Condos. My husband and I were traveling with my parents and our adult son, who is 21. The condo was booked by our travel agent. 1. We were not aware this property was a condo and not a hotel/resort type facility. There are no restaurants, drink service at the beach or any of the hotel type conveniences. There is prompt and courteous maid service and several eating establishments within walking distance. No value if you want room service. 2. The room was very nice size and plenty of room for our five travelers. It was horribly outdated with sea foam green and rose decor, indoor outdoor carpeting and rust in the bathtubs. The mattresses were well worn and we did not sleep well some nights. 3. The A/C in our unit did not work. The front desk clerk suggested we open the windows and that worked fine. There was a nice breeze most of the time. 4. The last day of our stay, the condo owners had some sort of party and the pool area was closed from 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm!! Completely unacceptable to pay for the few amenities and then not be able to use them on your last day at the condo. 5. The condos seem to be owned by retirees. My parents and I enjoyed that aspect.However, there was not one person in 6 days for my 21 year old son to communicate with at the condo. It is not a place for young people. 6. The views--unbelievable. Our ocean view room was spectacular. Sunsets were gorgeous every night. Too bad the condo was not. 7. The beach - unbelievable. The beaches on Maui are quite rocky, but this beach is wonderful. However, there was no seating on the beach. All of the lounge chairs were either poolside or on a ridge overlooking the beach with plants in front to block the spectacular views. There were signs to not move the chairs, so we did not. Lounging in a chair reading is one of my favorite things to do at the beach, with the silly rule, we were unable to do that on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “I sooooo would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Spagetinoodles15
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Royal Kahana and loved it even more this time! The location is awesome, literally right on the beach. So nice! For the price it beats many many hotels for an Ocean View. I would say our room which was titled "Ocean View" was just a good as if it was a "Ocean Front". I love that it is a condo, so you have a washer and dryer and full kitchen. We stayed in a one bedroom which was nice for the extra space. Maid service was awesome, as they even would put our dirty dishes in the dishwasher for us! So unexpected but very lovely. They provided beach towels for each person, which again was a nice surprise! I would definatley stay here again, had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot To Explore From”
Reviews.Author: farfromhome808
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in a condo when in Maui, but we only had our rental for 10 days on our last trip so we chose the Royal Kahana to stay for a few nights to extend our vacation out a few days. It was a good choice. While the rooms appear to have not been "refreshed" in a few years, they were well maintained, clean and nicely appointed. The kitchen area had a very large refrigerator and there were some utensils and pots to cook with. The bedroom was nice, with a good view, and while the bathroom was a bit small, no one goes to Maui to hang out there, right? The lobby was pleasant and the pool area was very nice. The only thing this hotel lacks is a real beach, but no one along that stretch of the island really has a beach to speak of anyway. On the whole the Royal Kahana is a good place to relax and recharge after a day spent strolling in Lahaina or snorkeling off shore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Kahana!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megs1636
Reviews.Content: The Royal Kahana went above and beyond our expectations! My husband and I aren't picky on our amenities, however, we still thought the Royal Kahana was a great place! Our room was suppose to be a "partial ocean view" and when we got to it...it was basically ocean front (we were on the 10th floor above the hotel beside us though.) The maid service was great, front desk staff was USUALLY very friendly, the HEATED pool was great, and the fitness center has just enough to get you through a basic workout. The only thing that wasn't great is there wasn't any place to lay on the beach..which the hotel really can't help, so they supply nice lawn chairs out front in their lawn area. The hotel is also a short drive to Lahaina and Kaanapali!

Reviews.Title: “You get the very basic...”
Reviews.Author: mgsusa
Reviews.Content: The good: The Activities Desk was good with lots of options. Free covered parking. Nice view from most rooms. Small kitchen, Washer and Drier in Room, very helpful for young kids. Location near to very beautiful beaches (5 to 10 minutes driving) The Bad: Itâ€™s a very simple hotel or condo with a mediocre swimming pool. The rooms are OK but could use a good refurb. Reception personnel were not very receptive or not willing to help. My kid got hurt in the pool area, the hotel didnâ€™t have a first-aid kit available. The hotel building blocks the sun from the beach in front of it. The hotel promises a $50 voucher from a nearby market on their website, when requested at check in, they said you donâ€™t qualify for it, although we spent more than 5 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: ilovehyatt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10 PM and found that the parking lot was not well lit and the over all look of the place was creepy. The lobby was well lit and check in went well. Upon arriving on the 8 th floor, I again found that the hallways were not well lit - I am not looking for sunshine indoors but I don't like walking through the hallway where some parts had no light at all. The vending machines are in the basement - extra creepy. A group of 3 women, this was a concern to us. Upon entering our studio, we got a real home feel and was very impressed with the ocean view, the moon seemed to just hover over the water - beautiful! The king sized bed was great for 2 of us but the third had to sleep on a pull out, single sized bed and thank goodness she was the smallest of the 3 or we would not have been able to turn about on it. The studio was nothing fancy but comfortable. The morning greeted us with bright sunshine and again that great ocean view. Now seeing the place in the daytime it didn't seem as creepy as at night, we enjoyed the beach being steps away and the pool was nice too. The beach is small, no chairs allowed, we sunbathed in the garden beside the beach and was able to enjoy the coolness from the water. A small strip mall is within walking distance with a brewery a steakhouse and McDonald's. Lahaina Cannery Mall is about 2 miles away to get groceries and shopping. And you must go to the Old Lahaina Luau right behind this mall, it will be worth the trip. Our stay here turned out great and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: duke1966
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Royal Kahana. It is not your "high" end hotel, but bascially a Super 8 with a kitchen and laundry (both very usefully). The staff has always been friendly and helpful. My 11 yr old son enjoys the pool and has met several friends over past visits. The location allows for easy access to Hwy 30 going south to Lahania and a very scenic driving north. The beachfront itself is small, but you can still take a stroll along the beach and see both whales and sea turtles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: ellaviaja
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was very apprehensive about this hotel before coming. It was part of a package so I didn't have a choice. I read a few reviews where people said there was literally no parking by late night and that it was a dump. Well, just spent the week there and was VERY happy and would most DEFINITELY return. First, the positives: the location is great because it's quiet and peaceful. It is a drive to get to the airport, Haleakala, or Hana, but I guess most places in Maui require some driving. The room itself is huge! I was happy to see a kitchen with dishes and a washer/dryer and a big balcony overlooking the water and Molokai even though I only was supposed to get a garden terrace (which I was told has no ocean view). There is also a nice little beachfront area and pool. This is a perfect place to bring children (because you can save money by using your kitchen, and there is the washer/dryer). Just a few things I would change: seems like it would be great if there were a bar at the pool, and there's even an area for it by the pool, but maybe it's a zoning issue (I did notice while swimming in the ocean that the other hotels nearby also didn't seem to have bars), or maybe to preserve the quieter atmosphere of this area. One small thing is that the shampoo/conditioner combo they give you is very drying, and I have oily hair. We just picked up shampoo at Walgreens nearby. This is definitely a no-frills hotel, but it was better than I expected for the price that this gets you in Maui. It was a very clean, comfortable, relaxing hotel--I couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to make as your base on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: GrahamandWendy_10
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Royal Kahana. It has many features that make it quite comfortable and convenient. The unit itself (804 - a studio) was nicely furnished and clean, with a beautiful view of sunsets from the lanai. There is an awesome cross-breeze, keeping it cool. That way, we could hear the surf and not the air conditioner, which we rarely used. The beach in front is uncrowded, but narrow. The pool is lovely, and very warm. It's great for a swim in the evening. We would recommend two beaches close by, both of which include a great beach walk. One is about five minutes north, in Kapalua. The walk winds along in front of the Ritz Carlton complex. It's quite beautiful, and includes a lava flow, a wild, rocky cove, and a surfing beach. The family oriented beach (safe, good snorkelling) is at the south end of the walk, with lots of parking. The other beach walk is five minutes south of the hotel, again with lots of parking, at the northern part of Ka'anapali Beach. This is a newer boardwalk, bordering one of the loveliest beaches that we visited. Stop and have lunch at Duke's (great food, good prices) while you're there. There are lots of restaurant options quite close to the hotel as well. Try China Boat for lunch and definitely the Brew Pub in the plaza just across the street from the hotel. We also loved "Canoe's" in Lahaina for half price appetizers in the afternoon. The sea turtles tend to congregate in the ocean right out front, so get a window seat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay.....friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KK_003
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place at all...but rooms have mostly partial view of ocean even if they call it ocean view....if u r taking the ones that are called Ocean Front (which r surely expensive) then they would be awesome.... But it is truely on beach side...just walk out on the back side and there u r...the beach is very narrow though....and is mostly not crowded....

Reviews.Title: “Not the finest hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler783
Reviews.Content: The hotel has old condo units. Bathrooms are aged, furniture is old, mattresses are sinking (must be 20 years old) and room definitely had mildew. I would not pay this rate had I known the place was going to be like this. They also do not have restaurant, bar, or lounge area. No service outside of a front desk person who oversells the hotel. Concierge was good. The location is good for getting out in Maui and restaurants nearby. The beach at the hotel is not good at all. I would look for other places to stay at, trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location, recommended condo property.”
Reviews.Author: Fergdawgster
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Royal Kahana was a great find -- great value, nice location, and worked out very well for us. Easy access to beach. The grills in the pool area came in very handy for us on several evenings. We did a lot of traveling all over Maui while we were there, and the Royal Kahana was nice to came home to at the end of a long day. The in-room kitchenettes are also a major convenience. Overall, it was a very memorable vacation. I would certainly recommend this property to anyone looking for a great value on a great property for the vacation in West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: bigmac1550
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Royal Kahana for closeness to the beach - no golf course to traverse to get there. It is very quiet, has great ocean views (stayed in #308) and is close to all needed amenities - plus has the convenience oif a washer/dryer in the unit. The condo was clean and nicely furnished. Blackout blinds in the bedroom would be nice as it gets light very early. The bathroom area is very small and dated but clean. Based on this some might feel it was overpriced at $199/night but you know what they say - location, location, location. I'm writing this review sitting in a smaller hotel room only - with an older bathroom at the Hawaiian Hilton Village - wishing I was back in Maui - and paying $259/night here) . It was our first visit to Maui and I chose the Royal Kahana blindly due to it's apparently closeness to the beach. After visiting we saw MANY resorts close by that charge way more -they may however be newer. However, we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation, time in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Kukel
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Hawaii. There is just something about the islands, we'll be back soon. The property was a great location, well maintained, clean and neat. We were there for 2 weeks and people were alway busy with landscaping and maintaining the property. The rooms might be a little dated, but they were clean, functional, well stocked and comfortable. The air conditioning worked great, was quiet compared to wall mounted units. We had an ocean view studio and whenever we weren't out, we would BBQ on the premises (no charge) and eat on the balcony, enjoying the sunset, a glass of wine, you can't help have that contented peaceful, feeling. The light daily maid service is great, providing beach towels as needed is such a plus. Next time we won't pack any. The tennis courts looked great, however just too busy on the beach and site-seeing during the day. Our daughter was more interested in spending time with other kids in the pool.. Not sure what the weather would be like in dec and january, suspect windier and rougher. But since July, hot and sunny every day. Rain was never more then a few minutes. The beach was narrow, but more then sufficient for strolls and gazing at Molokai. It was never busy. Napili can get quiet crowded. The water was great for swimming and floating. We love snorkelling, its pretty average, go early in the morning when calm. There are turtles and interesting creatures. They were able to accomodate a late check out of 6 pm and we were able to enjoy a full day at the beach before we sadly had to go. Its a great value with free parking. Don't change a thing, value is your niche. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property with some Disappointments in Service”
Reviews.Author: sebicap
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui for our honeymoon and stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana for part of our time on Maui. (We started out by touring the Upcountry in a B&B). The view from the ocean front room was spectacular and the rooms were very spacious and very nicely appointed. The A/C was inadequate to cool the whole unit but during the day we used the windows to have some air breeze through the room and at night the A/C cooled the bedroom just fine. The Service at the front desk was a bit lack luster but that seems to be a common occurence in Maui. The staff fails to acknowledge customers waiting at the window until they are done with whatever they're doing. A "I'll be right with you" during our wait would have added a personal touch and would have made us feel more like guests and less like an annoyance that the staff has to deal with. Another disappointment was that weeks prior to our stay at the Outrigger Royal Kahana, I contacted the Outrigger customer service about an unrelated matter and asked about honeymoon special perks. I was told that each property does something special for honeymooners although each does something different. Well, the person I talked to marked our account with "honeymoon" (big letters on our sign-in sheet) but the lady at the front desk looked at me like I had grown a third eye when I came down to get my luggage and asked her about it. She had no idea and told me that "we don't do anything special for honeymooners."

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: vgp000
Reviews.Content: On line reservations accepted for 1st floor garden view !, Pleasant surprise, hotel room was upgraded to a high level ocean view room. at no extra cost. The Hotel is a few minutes away from Kapalua airport, great after a 10 hour flight. Excellent Customer Service!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View!!”
Reviews.Author: bballmom52
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 24-30th and loved it! The property itself was very quiet and the grounds were well maintained. The view from our condo was amazing! We had a one bedroom ocean view room. Our bedroom had two huge windows which looked out on the ocean. The lanai had a table and chairs and looked out on the ocean as well. We ate breakfast out there every morning. The view was awesome!!! The beach at this condo is small but not as bad as some of the reviews state. We drove 5 minutes to Kaanapali Beach which has everything, shopping, food and a very large beach. If you are going to snorkel you can snorkel at Black Rock at Kaanapali Beach or drive to Honolua Bay! It is about 10 mins up the road from condo and about 5 to 10 min walk through what looks like a jungle, beautiful! We saw lots of fish and a turtle. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay this is your place. A great place to eat for breakfast or lunch is the Honolua Store in Kapalua it is awesome and lots of locals eat there!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jewels626
Reviews.Content: We chose the Royal Kahana for our honeymoon and had an amazing time. Our room 1212 had a beautiful view. The beach was really close, only a couple steps away. It wasn't busy, noisy or full of kids which is what we wanted. I didn't understand others' reviews about rooms being outdated. You're in Maui! Does it really matter? There were so many things to do in Maui, but we also enjoyed spending time at the condo. Thanks Royal Kahana for a wonderful honeymoon! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: sunrise1163
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2010 to celebrate our 25 anniversary. We had a beautiful room facing the ocean and absolutely loved our stay. The pool was beautiful and surrounded by such a wonderful garden and very well maintained. We loved the BBQ grills and used them a few times while we stayed during our 10 days. It was so fantastic sitting on the balcony and watching whales and turtles in the surf every day during breakfast and dinner! The evenings on the beach with the tiki torches and taking walks and watching the sunsets were fantastic, too. The rooms were cleaned nicely every day. The Royal Kahanna is just a bit north of the busiest West Maui areas of Kanaapli and Lahaina, but that was what we liked. I wish I would have known that I would have had a washer & dryer and I would not have packed so much! If you're going, be sure to go to Molokini to go snorkeling. It was awesome and Boss Frog's in Kahana is close and was really great. Also, a must do is Road to Hana (we did it twice and loved it)! When you do the Road to Hana, be sure to continue passed Hana, and go to the Seven Pools of Oheo. Loved it. And go to see the Haleakala Crater and do some hiking there, too, but watch how far you go because it is HARDER coming back out. Just a few comments that didn't really affect our stay, but maybe the Royal Kahanna could improve upon: Every time we stopped at the concierge to try to get discounts she was busy. Either on the phone or taking a very long time-- very long time -- with other customers that we would get tired of waiting and leave. So, we went elsewhere for discounts. We thought the staff at the front desk could have been a little more friendly and never greeted us once while we passed by. Perhaps getting them out from behind the glass would help? Maybe they feel isolated from the guests? Okay, that's Royal Kahanna and so much more. Loved it all and want to go back already.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, great location with stunning ocean front views!”
Reviews.Author: mydog46
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana Resort and was so impressed by the location and amenities. My view from my room and balcony was stunning. I was in an ocean front one bedroom condo unit and the ocean view was breath taking. Even from the pool deck you had an ocean view.....with bbq pits, ping pong tables, out door showers and literally steps away from the ocean. We walked up and down the beach at first light and then again at sunset. Not to mention the beautiful lawn area with tropical flowers and lush green grass fronting the beach. I highly recommend this property if you want to get out of the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali....(a tourist trap). I was on Maui for business yet it truly felt like a vacation at this resort. Having the full kitchen was a plus in the morning. You can even walk to a small shopping center one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good....but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: superMO81
Reviews.Content: The condo was clean. The service was ok. There is a nice little beach on site. But overall I thought this place was over priced. The front desk never had answers and I found the decor old. The location was ok, only 10 minutes from happening areas. I would say this place is worth about $100 a night. I wouldn't pay more then that. This is a good place if you plan on spending little to no time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCity2010
Reviews.Content: The attendant that checked us in was rude! It would have been nice if she would have gave us some general information about the resort such as where the ice machine and where there was additional parking, pool hours etc. She hands us some paperwork to complete then hands us a packet which didn't really have any pertinant information and says read this if you have any questions call the front desk. The room we stayed in was an angled viewed ocean view. Beautiful view of the ocean. If you are looking for luxury this is not the place for you. The maid attendants were so sweet and friendly. The resort definately needs some updating, but for the price and so you can do other excurisions it isn't a bad place to stay. I liked that they had gas bbq grills and kitchenettes, washer, dryer, ironing board, etc. I asked for a room with 2 beds because my 20 year old daughter was with us but instead we got a room with a king bed and a VERY small pull out sofa. Thank goodness she is only 4 foot 7 inches. I would go back again. The king size bed was comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Loved it!! Easy on the pocket also!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOntheGo028
Reviews.Content: This place was great me and my girlfriend stayed here at the same time in 2009 also, the service is very friendly and offer every type of activity known to man at very low rates snorkeling, sailing, laua's etc. The room was very clean and comfortable all rooms come with sitting area and kitchenette. its about a 15 minute ride from Lahaina but Ka'anapali beach is right up the road. I really enjoyed my stays here make sure to check out Roy's for great Hawaiian fusion and Maui brewing company for a late night happy hour!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ssiloi
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at this hotel! It isn't the most contemporary place, but it was clean and very comfortable. When we checked in, much to our surprise, we were given a studio with an ocean view, expecting the garden view (which is what we paid for). This was definitely a great start to our vacation. Angie, at the front desk, was very helpful, and gave us tips on good local restaurants and shopping. Our family is planning a big family vacation next year, and we will be staying at the Royal Kahana. **Free parking is definitely a plus! And being right on the beach is amazing. I did not know that the property was as far from the airport as it is, but that was just lack of research on my part. We actually ended up liking Lahaina side way better than Kihei&Kahului.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: pinkey47
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and supplied with everything we needed. perfect place for a very laid back vacation. great location to shopping and grocery stores. beach view was great and am planning on being back next year with the kids. Mom promised a trip to Florida for a graduation present but after he seen the pictures this is the place he wants to come to. cant wait to come back. Dawn

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not the most modern”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: While these are condominium units, this is operated as a hotel with fully staffed desk. Our room was really not in the best physical shape especially the bathrooms. While listed as ocean view, it was set back with just a very angled view of the ocean. The room was quite noisy at night when the wind blew outside. The staff downstairs were very friendly and helpful and there is maid service. Was a short car ride to Lahaina and Kapalua Beach. There are restaurants and stores within very short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: Karuck
Reviews.Content: The condo was very comfortable and clean. We enjoyed cooking for the first time after weeks of staying in hotels. The bed was a great size and very comfortable. It had all the cooking utensils required as well as complimentary coffee and laundry detergent which was very handy. There were supermarkets nearby to stock up on supplies. Like previous comments this is definetly not a luxury resort, the room was dated and the material on the balcony floor in our room was torn. The room that we stayed in you could see the ocean, I think that most rooms face the ocean, the one thing that we noticed was the seal on the balcony door was quite poor and you could hear the wind howling through the room and in particulart at night this was quite distracting. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was not much beach in front of the hotel. Most people used the beach to walk along rather then lying there. There was ample of free parking and a gas station nearby to fill up prior to returning the hire vehcile back.. The concierge was really helpful in giving discounted prices for tours however, you do need to be aware that you may need to attend a timeshare presentation to receive heavily discounted prices on the tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: boomerdog01
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of this condo as it was right on a nice beach and within walking distance of many restaurants & shops. It's nothing fancy, but clean. It had a very small pool, but nice lounge chairs and located right on a nice swimming beach. We saw huge sea turtles swimming right here couple of days! There was a washer and dryer in our condo and the kitchen had everything we needed. If you're interested in luxury, this place isn't for you. But we really enjoyed the location of this condo and would recommend it if you wanted to save money on your resort and spend more on activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LiviaChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice, QUIET location. Cose to a couple of restaurants on a local little plaza with some shops, coffee place, gas station, etc. Nice swimming pool, access to beautiful, quiet, clean beach. We were so pleased to see that our room which was described as the one with a garden view had indeed partly ocean view! Our room # 108 was on the first floor and we had a great access through our open balcony to the common tarrace and to the garden, swimming pool and beach. Just one sec and we were there. The room 108 is the first one in the row of I guess five rooms but we did not have the feeling like we are on a display. We also felt very safe even it was first floor. The kitchen had everything we needed to make our own breakfast what saved us some money. No internet at room. The one in the main lobby does not work smoothly - waisting your time and money. I would recommend a local coffee shop with internet access and very friendly staff. Generally great hotel, geat location, great room - made our vacation great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: nandipandi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Room 306, an Ocean View room. We had read complaints about the outdatedness of the resort so we were a little nervous as we did not know our room assignment until we arrived. We were very happy with our room, our view and the resort in general. Unlike many condo rentals you do get maid service everyday and they are wonderful! Our first night there we realized we didn't have a dishcloth so we rinsed the dishes and placed them in the sink (not enough to load the dishwasher)- they were washed, dried and put away when we returned much to our surprise. The view was awesome and altough the beach is a bit rocky directly in front of the resort, only a hundred feet down it was fine. The staff were kind and helpful, the pool area was very nice and the pool is heated which is very nice in the evening. The resort was most impressive on the day of the Tsunami warning when they kept calm and collected and very organized. We were all evacuated up to the top floor where they opened up any available rooms for the use of displaced guests. After the warning cleared they were very kind to those of us that were checking out late and made it very easy for us to be on our way. The location of the resort is nice because it is not in an overcrowded area yet still only a few minutes away from Lahaina and other beaches. We really did enjoy our stay here and would recommend it as a great value and a nice place to relax after a day exploring the island.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a stay in this area”
Reviews.Author: lyn065
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be excellent. The suites were roomy and furnishings of high quality. Lovely views. Generally fairly central to all activities on this North side of Maui. The suite actually greatly exceed our expectations.Our requests were met promptly and effciently. It is not a resort, (which I consider to be a plus), but accessability to resorts was easy

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: seahorse002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana for 2 wks while in Maui, in March 2010. We had a studio with an ocean view... and WHAT a view it was! We could watch whales from our lanai and also saw turtles on the beach. The beach in front of the condo was not great for swimming, but just a 2 minute walk further down, it was perfect. There was always a nice breeze blowing through the unit and we didn't ever have to turn on the air conditioning. It had everything one needed in the kitchenette including a blender, toaster, stove/oven, fridge, dishes and pots and pans and more. Having a washer and dryer in the unit was more handy than I ever imagined... how nice that was! The king sized bed apparently was bought 2 yrs ago and it was REALLY comy (and I'm picky!). The flat screen tv looked new too and there was also a stereo entertainment system that you could play DVD movies on and hook up your i pod to as well. You can rent movies from the store behind the condo from a machine for 99 cents - gotta love it! Houskeeping would come in every day (if you wanted them too) and they did an excellent job. All the staff were very friendly. The excercise room was well equipped with everything you need for a good work-out. Yes, you could pay a LOT more for a 5 star place, and if that's what you're looking for, then pay the extra. We stayed in room 1005 and felt very comfortable there. We would definitely recommend the Royal Kahana - excellent value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: akangel40
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another wonderful trip to Maui. This time we took our 18 year old daughter along. We stayed at the Royal Kahana 9 wonderful nights. We had unit #108 one bedroom bottom floor garden view with a view of the ocean as well. The unit was spacious and very clean, there was plenty of room and privacy for us. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook the meals we chose to. The unit also had a washer and dryer which was great. We were amazed at how quiet the hotel was, everynight we would sleep with the windows open listening to the ocean waves it was truley wonderful. The view was amazing, we saw many whales right from our lanai. The beach is nice for walking and turtle watching, we did see people snorkeling in front of the hotel as well. We did pay to use the internet for a week and had no problems at all. The grounds were nicely kept and the pool was heated. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was plenty of parking. The hotel is only 10 minutes away from Lahaina. We were looking for a nice place to just relax and enjoy the Maui sunshine and it looks like we have found it..

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend the Outrigger Royal Kahana.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2relax62
Reviews.Content: We didn't check in until 9:30 p.m. (on a Saturday) after flying all day to get to Maui. We were given a choice of rooms on the second or the seventh floor; we opted for the one on the seventh floor because we really enjoy watching the whales from our lanai (we've stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana the past three years and knew that the location offered outstanding whale-watching). When we got to the room though we discovered it was on the poolside of the building and the ocean view wasn't as good as we'd had in the past. The individual on the desk did some searching and found another room on the side of the building we preferred but suggested we wait until morning to switch rooms since we must be tired. All of the personnel were extremely pleasant and helpful the remainder of our stay as well. The rooms are large, very clean, and the kitchen stocked with all necessary small appliances, dishes, etc. Wed especially like having a washer and dryer in the room. The location is not only great for whale-watching, but also convenient to shopping and dining as well as some excellent beaches (e.g Kapalua Bay). We didn't get a chance to use the tennis courts this visit, but have in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tmepg
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Maui and we enjoyed it. I had done extensive research for our trip but because of the dates we could travel we could not get into the hotel that I had picked so at the last minute Westjet suggested the Royal Kahana. We arrived on Friday Feb 26th to a clean room in a hotel filled with pleasant people. We were in a ground floor studio and really loved the room with the full kitchen. The next morning we woke to tsunami sirens. What a way to start a vacation. The staff were helpful and vertically evacuted us to the tenth floor. Thank goodness nothing came of the tsunami and we loved the view of our new room so much we kept it. We sat on our lanai eating dinner watching the whales. It was very peaceful. The grounds are beautiful and the staff are helpful. I heard that there was a turtle sunning itself right out front of the hotel but I did not see him:( The hotel has an Expedia desk right onsite so we were able to book a scuba trip and a helicopter tour of the island right there. I recommend going to their little talk at 8:30 in the morning. The girls know the island and what there is to see. Daisy Mae is very friendly and helpful. Just remember not to overbook yourselves as Kahana is a bit away from the Ma'alaea Harbour and the airport so you spend alot of time driving. But the hotel is very peaceful and quiet. We met alot of very nice people from the US and lots of fellow Canadians. The only thing that bothered me was the wind. We were told it was unusually windy but the wind never stopped. Ever. So bring a jacket as it does blow at this end of the island. If it bothers you like it did me, do what I was told to do......if you don't like the weather in Maui, drive 15 minutes down the beach. We did this and it was beautiful. So thank you Royal Kahana for giving us our first taste of Maui. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: weheartjamaica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 9 nights on our fabulous trip to Maui. We originally booked a Garden View room, but were delighted to find that they had upgraded our room when we went to check in. From our lanai, we had a gorgeous view of the ocean & Moloka'i. We had a studio room, and it was very clean and spacious. It was great to have a small kitchen and the washer/dryer. Nothing overly fancy, just a really nice place to stay. The location was great as well! Close to all the great beaches, but not in a congested area. Also, it is within walking distance to various shops and restaurants which was very convenient. There's even a general store where you can pick up groceries, souveniers or any items you may have forgotten to pack! The beach is nice if you have a few free minutes and just want to take in the beautiful views. We frequently saw sea turtles swimming right up to the beach. Was always quiet at night, no troubles sleeping. Not far to travel to get to Lahaina, where there are tons of restaurants and shopping, as well as the harbour. We were on the go for most of our vacation and found this hotel suited our needs just fine. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful when we need directions or advice on where to go. The cleaning services would even do our dishes for us if there were any left in the sink. Definitely was not expecting that! A great deal for the price, in my opinion! Would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but wouldn't tell anyone to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: travel012345
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dated but clean. Housekeeping in our room was excellent. The washer and dryer were extremely noisy. Front desk staff were rude. Felt like I was imposing on them if I asked any questions. The bathroom was really small and the door came within 2" of the toilet. The TV in our room (516) had horrible sound and engineering had to take the dvd player apart to get our dvd back out. If you like to swim laps, the pool is too small for that. I wouldn't not stay here again, but its not likely that I would either. Overpriced for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “The 25th anniversary marriage !!”
Reviews.Author: urayasu-Godzilla
Reviews.Content: The front desk prepared for the room which was more splendid than the room which I booked. .We stayed for 4 night 5 days.The 25th anniversary marriage was commemorative and did it for the purpose of relaxing with my wife. We were able to spend it happily. When I come to Maui Island, I intend to use it again. Thank you for your assist. Hiroshi Ono

Reviews.Title: “Royal Kahana Outrigger was great”
Reviews.Author: Bill038
Reviews.Content: Our condo at this site was the best. The room was clean and newly furnished. The view of the whales daily was amazing and sea turtles out front every day. Just a wonderful place to spend a vacation. Room 807 was really nice. We saw all the sites of Maui on the two weeks we were there form Feb 13-26, 2010. The staff at Royal Kahana Outrigger were great and very friendly. It was disappointing to be told I could not book the same room again next year even if I booked it well in advance. I understand all the condos are different with slightly different views but I would like the same one next time

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: chauders7
Reviews.Content: We were put here because Aina Nalu overbooked. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit on the 3rd floor facing the ocean. It was a great view. The decor was a little outdated but functional. The kitchen was stocked with pots, pans and utensils but don't use the spices. All expired. The bathroom was small but it looked like it was recently remodeled. The living room was pretty spacious. A flat screen tv with cable was nice during the evenings. The unit was nice, overall it's a quiet place but you do occasionally hear people walking down the hall or car alarms go off in the parking lot. The in room safe was small. I'm use to the electronic ones that can fit a laptop. This one required a key and I think you had to get it from the front desk. I didn't waste my time. The service was nice. The front desk was very helpful when I need suggestions on where to eat or where to go. Housekeeping came by with great service each day. They even washed our dirty dishes that we left in the sink. Wasn't expecting that. The location is not bad. It's right off the highway. There are a few close places to eat. Okazuya is down the same street.. about a mile down. Further down is Times Supermarket. It's convenient but pricey. I'd drive down to Lahaina to the Safeway there. Right across the street is a McDonalds, Roys, and a coffee shop that has WiFi. WiFi is available in your room but they charge for it. No free wifi here. Ka'anipali beach is within 5-10 minutes. Great snorkeling at Black Rock. Overall a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER....”
Reviews.Author: 49alumni
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 307....lovely ocean view...beautiful decor...state of the art kitchen....couldn't have asked for more....since this was our 15th trip to maui, we've seen a few other places..... Staff was excellent....Tim & the staff at the desk answered every problrm....housekeeping was attentive, kind & friendly.....the Expedia tour desk was excellent We had seen almost everything on the island but wanted to do a whale watch...they arranged a lovely one with the Pacific Wildlife Foundation.....inexpensive, informative, easy parking at their site.....couldn't have asked for more.... Thanks to all for helping me celebrate my 78th b'day on Maui..... Many mahalos to all

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eeyoremn
Reviews.Content: First time to Maui and was travelling with my 75 year old mother. We cried the morning we left! We stayed in unit #309 and it was wonderful. The only complaint I have is the pull out couch, where I slept. OUCH!!!! Other than that, we slept every night with the lanai doors open listening to the waves. In the morning we watched the whales jump from our lanai. We're already planning another vacation and this is where we plan to stay. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “A sure step down from your last resort”
Reviews.Author: bigronman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and were already given a heads up by our agent that for this second leg of our trip (our first was in Kauai) the resort accommodations would not be as great. Well... let me say that even with low expectations we were immediately on the horn with our booking agent prepared to throw any amount of money to get us out of this place. We made every effort to work with the friendly staff to find a suitable room, but either they only have a couple rooms that merit the positive rooms I see on Trip Advisor or they just didn't have any other rooms updated any earlier than 1987. Primary issue was the very strong undertone of cleaning product which seems to be an attempt to cover up mildew (I live and breathe enough to know what it smells like). The dated appearance of appliances, fixtures, cabinetry and furniture just added to feeling of an unsanitary condition. Maybe if there was the smell with brand new appliances, granite countertops, etc it would have been easier but when every sensory perception is just overwhelmed with "stale" it becomes something even a guy can't ignore. Oh... another comment. The "ocean view" as was defined by the concierge, was just that - we had about 10% view of the ocean. Buyer beware on this whole "ocean view - ocean front" term. The rest of the view was of the hotel across the way. I just can't recommend to anyone since this place is more fit to be attached to an Atlantic City casino than beautiful Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Royally Awful, checking out as soon as I can...”
Reviews.Author: SarahNYC_8
Reviews.Content: I came to this property for my honeymoon with my husband and we were "upgraded" to a large two bedroom unit- which sounded good in theory- but in fact it was absolutely the worst room I have EVER been in. Leaving aside the dated decor (which I could have lived with) the cleanliness was questionable, the place smelled like chlorine and mold, and the bed had a big dent down the center. This is my honeymoon and all I wanted to do was cry. On top of that our ocean view was just that- a glimpse. We made the staff aware that our room was unacceptable and they were very nice and apologetic and promptly moved us to a studio which was only marginally better and only because the bed didn't sag. It's not their fault the place is so dogged- they did their best. We agreed to take it for tonight but we're leaving tomorrow. I feel like I might as well have checked into one of the local B&B's for this kind of accomodation at half the price. Oh and by the way, my husband couldn't even get a soda from their machine because it was broken. And the pool is crowded with the same obnoxious me-first folks who make my daily life on the east coast so special. I'm devastated that I've even wasted this much time dealing with this issue, and I suggest you avoid this place unless you don't mind strange smells, sagging beds and questionable cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good but awful bed”
Reviews.Author: Rosssco2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Royal Kahana. The hotel was nice overall with a good concierge and pool area. The beach was not bad. My only complaints were the horrible bed which was WAY too soft and the fact the the "ocean-view" which was glancing at best.

Reviews.Title: “Accomidations appreciated-Customer service needed work”
Reviews.Author: doty_79
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon and we were very pleased with size of room and also view. Agree with other reviews that needs to be updated, but over all we enjoyed the room-great size, separte living area and convienent to shops and activities. We did not appreciate the customer service from the main desk, except by the matured male who work part time at the check in date(he was kind, accomidating and knowledgable). Other then the customer service we enjoyed experience.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES!!”
Reviews.Author: wifeofb
Reviews.Content: My family-me, husband, 2 daughters, son-in-law and granddaughter-spent a week here for Christmas. The hotel/condos were built in the '70's and ours had naver been updated. Rm.220-DO NOT STAY IN THIS CONDO!! The appliances were so old and disgusting we only made breakfast-and that was cereal and toast-nothing we really had to cook...the washer and dryer were so old and rusty I told the rest of the family we would just wash clothes when we got to the Big Island...I only washed beach towels-which never got dry because the machines were so old. We had ants in the second bathroom! These must be privately owned and then rented out by Outrigger because our granddaughter wandered into some other condos that had their doors open and they were beautiful and modern...thankfully the Outrigger on the Big Island-Fairway Villas-MORE than made up for this disgusting place. And the "fitness center" was a treadmill in the dark basement...

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an active vacation on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Olistina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in unit 816 (Ocean View Studio) in early January 2010. The room itself is large enough: king size bed, seating area with couch and TV + DVD player, dining area, kitchen with 4 burners, MW oven and fridge. Nice lanai (Patio) with outdoor table and chairs, with a great view on Lana'i and, in this season, plenty of whale action. Everything seems a bit dated, but totally clean and in good shape. The room is cleaned everyday, they even do your dishes (we left tips every morning, that might have helped). They have Washer and Dryer, with detergent. We didn't use the amenities at all - there is a pool, the beach... but I can't really review those. There is plenty of free parking, and the location is excellent: 45 mins from Kahului airport and Kihei, 15 min from Lahaina, 10 min from Ka'anapali, 3 min from a grocery store (one is towards the South on the Highway, on to the North). This is a pretty good location if you plan on having an active vacation. I wouldn't call it ideal for plain beach vacation because the beach here isn't as nice as other places. We went up North after Kapalua for some great hikes recommended by the indispensable book "Maui Revealed". We didn't try the wireless internet but they have 2 computers in the lobby to use - $2 for 5 min I seem to recall.

Reviews.Title: “VERY POOR...SO DISAPPOINTED WE CHECKED FOR LAST FEW DAYS..”
Reviews.Author: Sam1734
Reviews.Content: ok..well there was 1 major plus and that was the washer and dryer but that was about it... not sure what everyone is raving about to be honest... the building is ugly and looks depressing before you even get to the room and the pool area was really depressing the door to our condo was enough to make me nervous as it looked like it had been broken into then nattily fixed. the condo itself- in desperate need of a lick of paint as well as a good old clean....food splash marks on the wall- grubby hand prints...stained carpet bathroom run down...shower on its last legs and as you turned the handle the whole thing nearly came off in my hand.hair dryer close to sink and rust all over it- too scared to use it in case i electrocuted myself. what i would say is if your renting a car anyway you may as well stay a little further out in Napili as it is pretty with great cheap hotels or just stay in lahaina if you can as a much better location as you have the harbour etc.... i was sooooo disappointed i felt it would ruin our new years eve if we spent it there so went crazy and blew the budget by booking into the Westin for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay - the condo needed updating”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 17 through Dec 23, 2009. This was our second trip to the Outrigger. The service is great! I was a little disappointed in the condo. It was an ocean front 1 bedroom, but clearly needed updated. The location of the Outrigger is really the best. You are close to everything! Parking is free. We were on the 11th floor. The elevator was really fast! We grilled out one night and was pleasantly surprised on how clean the grills were. The pool was really nice - right by the beach. I do highly recommend this resort and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Travel Option to Resort Hotels”
Reviews.Author: TitaNui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana from Dec. 20-25. We chose to stay there because it gave us the option of cooking some of our own meals. We enjoy preparing and eating our own meals, even while on vacation. The Royal Kahana is also away from the craziness of Lahaina (we call it Little Waikiki) and the long row of pricey resort hotels in Ka'anapali. Yet, it is a fairly short drive into Lahaina for the requisite visits. Free hotel parking and didn't find the parking problems some other reviewers seemed to have. Unit 518, a studio condo, was delightful. It appeared to have been recently repainted. The kitchen was adequately equipped with cookware, appliances, plates, etc. Our "ocean view" certainly was not spectacular, due to the design of the building. But, we could see the ocean from specific angles in our room and from one end of the lanai. We could hear the ocean at night, which made the "ocean view" upgrade worthwhile. Maybe they should say "ocean sound", instead. One negative: the bathroom is very tiny. The toilet is inches away from the bathtub making it difficult to step into the bathtub if you have any type of mobility impairment. Housekeeping arrived daily for this unit and did a very conscientious job. On the whole, it was a VERY quiet hotel. One exception was an early-rising couple a floor below us who had breakfast two mornings on their lanai at 6:30 a.m. and talked excitedly and loudly to each other during their meals. I admit that I did "bark" at them during their second breakfast and reminded them that others were still trying to sleep. They quickly made their way into the room to carry on their energetic conversation. Muted, but better. Families and children were constantly using the shuffleboard and ping pong recreation areas. We did have to ask the front desk at 8:30 p.m. one night, what time the ping pong room closed. He responded that it closed at 10. A very loud family was using it, making it difficult for us to watch TV that evening. However, a few minutes after our call, the noise and activity from that area seemed to stop altogether. We later found out that the room was supposed to close at dusk. It took a total of 5 hours and two phone calls to the front desk for several dirty, wet towels someone left in the hallway to be removed one evening. Beach towels are available from the front desk. Persons unfamiliar with ocean swimming, tides and currents should swim in the hotel's pool. The beach fronting the Royal Kahana is not the type a novice with oceans should attempt. You might also try the gentler beaches of Ka'anapali fronting those monstrous hotels. Hawai'i requires public access to beaches, so you can use the beach even though you don't stay at one of those hotels. There is no restaurant on grounds. (That's one of the reasons the kitchens are useful.) There are several options for meals close by. The front desk people suggested the Okazuya down the road. Great local plate lunches and other local kine stuffs. Also, ask the concierge for coupons for some of the other restaurants! The best point of this hotel was Genie C. , the concierge. She doesn't work every day, but if you get a chance to go to her 8:30 am presentation, go. I've always avoided the activities sales pitch by hotel concierge. I was dragged to this one and am happy I went. Since she is a local girl, she is sensitive to Hawaiian and local folks' issues. She subtly discourages island visitors from exploring Maui's most sacred spots, and points them toward more tourist-friendly activities. If you are in Maui during whale-watching season, make sure you book an excursion with the Pacific Whale Foundation! It's worth every penny of the very reasonable fee. An evening at the production 'Ulalena is also a must. It is a very unique and compelling show for both malihini (new-comers) and kama'aina (local folks). Both will learn, or be reminded of, ancient and modern Hawaiian culture and history. If we return to Maui, we will certainly book another stay at the Royal Kahana. A hui hou, Royal Kahana!

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo unit”
Reviews.Author: Purrfectpeggy
Reviews.Content: We spent from December 5 to December 9th at the Outrigger Royal Kahana. It was a bit outdated but plenty of room for mom and dad and two adult daughters. Was clean and had all the needed kitchen utensils. Was great to have separate bedrooms and two baths. Location was good but it was 1 1/2 hour drive to the volcano or the beginning of the Road to Hana. We stayed in a corner unit on 6th floor, can't remember exact number. Had a partial ocean view off the lanai. Nice swimming pool but not much of a beach. Waves were huge during our stay. The sights are beautiful in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: glwAnchorageAlaska
Reviews.Content: First time staying in a condo unit and it worked out real well. Room 712 was dated and could use some revamping, but it was clean and suitable. Nice resturants within walking distance but a bit spendy with the exception of McDonalds. Lahina a short drive away and had everything you might need. The Internet service was very poor and I found it necessary to piggyback off another unsecured network to use the computer. Over all, it was a real value and would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BrandonMississippi
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this condo accomodation by our vacation consultant, Kay Ryan, who suggested this place. It is in a great location on the beach away from the more crowded atmosphere of Lahaina. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The room was very clean and the well maintained. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Maui”
Reviews.Author: Logge
Reviews.Content: We spent the first five days of our three week Hawaii vacation at the Royal Kahana and was very pleased with the stay. The room was clean, spacious (for two) and fully equipped with a beautiful although slightly angled view of the ocean. We didn't spend a lot of time on the hotel grounds but rather used it as a base for exploring the west side of Maui. The beach by the hotel is nice, but there are much better ones just a few minutes by car to the north. Definitely go to Kapalua bay for some great and sheltered snorkeling. There is also an excellent Expedia desk at the hotel which we used to book most activities during our stay, even the ones we did the following week on the Big Island.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful setting!”
Reviews.Author: chicagofan66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Kahana for 4 nights. Yes, it is nestled back in a "residential" area of Maui, but the peace and quiet was wonderful! The property is located right on the beach. We could hear the waves at night from our condo- with all the windows open. I think we were in unit 512. It was a one-bedroom. very nice. the kitchen and bath were just remodeled. the lanai overlooked the pool and ocean. We were able to stay away from the touristy Lahaina/Whaler's Village area- and enjoyed it. The concierge was great- we booked a snorkel trip through her- with the Pacific Whale Foundation....best thing we did! It was a wonderful day! Found that Dollies bar/restaurant was good for pizza, and the China Boat was pretty good as well. I would recommend this property. It is casual, relaxed and welcoming. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations with spectacular ocean views”
Reviews.Author: dshea1013
Reviews.Content: This condo/hotel was perfect for myself, my husband, and our adult son. We had two spacious bedrooms (one king/master on the ocean side with private access to the lanai, one with two queens, not within earshot of the surf) with private baths, a comfortable living room with big-screen TV, a kitchen with basic equipment, dining area, and a powder room. Best, though, was the wrap-around lanai overlooking the beach within direct sight of Lanai and Molokai. During our 10-day stay, we saw turtles and rainbows nearly every day as we shared breakfast at the table on the lanai. I'll bet that whale-watching during the winter is amazing from this 8th floor unit (#810).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Hi
Reviews.Content: We were orginally looking at Royal Lahaina, but saw that that hotel charges for parking. We stayed at Royal Kahana Oct. 8 to 11. This condo had plenty of "free" parking when we were there and not too small stalls too. The front desk ladies were nice and there is free coffee every morning by the front office. We used the washer and dryer, refrigerator and microwave oven. The one bedroom had lots of room and the one day we asked for maid service, it was done well. We stayed in room 215, so we walked up and down many times from and to the parking lot. We had some ocean view and view of the pool area. You can walk to McDonald's a short distance away. We drove to Pineapple Grill in Kapalua and enyoyed that for lunch. We played in a tennis tournament at the Royal Lahaina Tennis Ranch, which is about 3 miles away, for two days and practiced briefly at one of the two tennis courts at the Royal Kahana. This condo is somewhat close to Kaanapali and Kapalua and not too far from Lahaina. They have two computers in the lobby that you can use for a price and a concierge service. A few things - my wife thought that the towels were somewhat "black" from prior use, but they were washed. The ceiling fan in the bedroom didn't work and my wife thought it was a bit hot in the room. The air conditioner worked okay, though I thought it was a bit noisy; but maybe a/c's are mostly like that. Toward the end, the breezes picked up and you could feel them if you left the patio and bedroom windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet and relaxed beach condo”
Reviews.Author: marleylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after searching in the Kahana and Napili areas for a condo with AIR CONDITIONING! We found it at the Outrigger Royal Kahana! We stayed in an oceanview studio with an AMAZING view! We would probably reserve a one-bedroom condo next time because there was not much space to spread out, but the room was overall nicely furnished. We were very glad we had air conditioning because this was the only vacation we have ever had in Maui when there were NO tradewinds. Without the usual wind blowing, the temperature was very warm and air was needed. Thanks for putting air conditioning into these condos and making our vacation very enjoyable! The beach is a nice walking and swimming beach without being crowded. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Condo 811 â€“ What a GREAT place to stay in!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelseemore
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in condo 811 for 5 nights in August. It exceeded all of our expectations! This condo is truly remarkable! It has all the features one would hope for in a vacation rental: It is comfortable, beautiful, clean, fully stocked, conveniently located near many beaches and restaurants, relaxing â€“ and as a big added bonus â€“ it has an amazing view from the most extraordinary, large, wrap-around lanai. We visited 4 islands in 3 weeks and stayed in many different private homes and condominiums throughout our trip â€“ but this one was our favorite by far. It truly delivered paradise at its best! We thank Bill and Dondi for sharing their beautiful home away from home with us, for making all the communications and necessary arrangements so easy and pleasant, and for being so accommodating. We look forward to our next trip and to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lorielyn60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Maui. We stayed at the Outrigger Royal Kahana for the week of August 22nd-29th, 2009.The staff was great and and the room was clean.We stayed in room 806 and it was awesome! We had a beautiful view of the ocean and beach. We enjoyed the sunsets from the lanai every evening. We went on a snorkle adventure on the Hula Girl. We had a wonderful time on this beautiful, new catamaran. We booked our entire vacation with Maui Kay (Kay Ryan). She took care of all of our arraingements and even met us at the condo to personally deliver our Hula Girl tickets.She is an awesome travel agent and you can book your Maui adventure with her at www.mauikay.com. We will be asking for her help with our next trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the value.”
Reviews.Author: IgnoredDad
Reviews.Content: June 2009 trip was great. Family with two teens plus one pre-K. It's a condo resort, not a full service hotel so services are limited. No restaurant / stores on property. Vending machines limited. Plenty of parking but narrow spaces. Ping pong table, saunas in basement. Has several gas grills for cookouts (utensils available) and a party pavilion for larger groups. Nice wide beach when tide out, much narrower when tide in. Front desk staff was helpful as was the concierge service to arrange activities. Nice clean pool. Ask at housekeeping or front desk for pool towels you use all week. No kids pool, so had to keep the little one close at hand as pool got deep quickly. Lots of sun on pool area in June. Well stocked convenience store / gas station and laundromat across the street along with McDonalds and four sit down restaurants / drinking establishments within one block with a range of prices. All were good with typical Hawaiian prices. Nice grocery store and more casual restaurants about one mile down the road to the south. Be adventurous and try them! We had an 8th floor, end room, 2 bdrm, 2 bath suite with a view and it was big, very clean, no bugs, functional and everything worked except we couldn't figure out the DVD player. It turned on but wouldn't display. Opening the windows created a great wind tunnel so we shut off the AC and enjoyed the breeze. Washer and dryer are stacked, apartment size with internal dryer vent. They run noisy, but since they are in one of the bathrooms, you can close the door. Kitchen was fully stocked with utensils, dishes and glasses. KEY TRAVEL TIP - We lightly tipped the housekeeping staff early in our weekly stay so they even put the dishes in the dishwasher and ran it for us and took the trash out! Then we tipped upon our departure. We bought a travel package through Costco Travel so it came with a $150 gift card for a grocery store in Lahaina. Saved us a bunch of money on drinks, fruit to snack on and breakfast/snack items. Cooking at the condo saved money for our larger family. They had to do some plumbing maintenance in our wing while we were there but they posted notices in advance and the workers met the schedule estimated. Since it's a condo, you get owners / time share owners as guests. Who owns condos? A mixed crowd but it trends older (40+). This is not the hot bod, in-crowd spot if you're looking to party down. If you need or want the full service hotel experience, don't stay here and then rip it in a review. It is a great value, clean and everyone was friendly. A bit far out on the NW coast so everything is a drive. But we've stayed in Makena before and everything is a drive from there, too! We had modest expectations and they were fully met. FYI - Recommend using the concierge to plan your adventures and reservations at good restaurants. It saves time and waiting and helps with scheduling your time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - A wealth of COMPLIMENTARY amenities included in base price!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiin1
Reviews.Content: First of all, we arrived a bit early, however the hotel offered & provided a secure place for us to store our luggage so we coud go sightseeing. When we returned our room was ready! When we got into the room we were amazed! We had an ocean view which was so gratifying, but we also had afull kitchen with cookware, plates, the works. There was also a washer & dryer in the room and laundry soap was provided! The room also had FREE wi-fi... which didn't seem to be the NORM in Hawaii. We stayed at a place in Waikiki that cost three times as much and didn't provide ANY of that! The Royal Kahana is the BEST value for the money!!!! Made for a SUPERB honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Wholly unsatisfying lodging experience”
Reviews.Author: MolotovCocktail
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.... DO NOT visit if you're a smoker. You have to completely leave the hotel grounds to have a cigarette and they're very unapologetic about it. DO NOT visit if you're with your lover. There's absolutely no romance about the place. DO FEEL FREE to visit if you're with a family on a budget. Odds are your mom will clean up after you. Positives: The room was clean and it had a small kitchen which came in handy. It was air-conditioned and well lit. Not a bad location, but you need a car to get anywhere interesting. Also, it was quite inexpensive, which was the reason I chose it in the first place. Negatives: (This is the difficult part to know where to start). 1. Their beach. It was dirty and had more bugs and wanut-sized crabs than I saw anywhere else near Lahaina. The water was sandy and muddy and I really didn't want to go in. 2. Their pool. It's peanut-sized, and they don't seem to be interested in cleaning it very often. There were a handful of chairs to lie in, but no point of interest to keep you there. 3. Their internet. It was down for 5 out of 6 days of my stay, and the staff had no control over it. They were happy to apologize and direct me to their off-site tech support, which went directly to voice mail with no follow-up or results. VERY annoying. When I finally got access on the 6th day, the connection was sporradic and slower than your average DSL. 4. Their room service. I actually had to request that they remove the wet towels on the floor after they had been there for three daysstraight--and they STILL DIDN'T DO IT. The staff was quite polite when you talked with them, but the conversation(s) never resolved in any results. 5. Their rooms. My room's outside-facing glass door was so poorly designed that when breezes hit it (which is the standard for Hawaii) it howled like a force 5 tornado. This made it difficult to sleep. Also, the bed's headboard was not properly attached to the frame, so it slammed against the wall at the nudge of a toe. (not to mention any other activity, in which case i'd sorely pity the next-door neighbors!) 6. Their parking. The spots are tiny and if you come in any time after 7 pm you have to park at the end of the lot. 7. Their grounds. There really weren't any. No lawn to speak of--just a lot of poorly kept pavement. All in all--I really can't recommend it and will not be returning. Their staff was very polite and nice, but never actually accomplished anything I asked for(which wasn't much). The room was clean when I arrived, but room service was not interested in keeping it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: karynkay
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through Northwest World Vacations for our 25th wedding anniversary. It was an airfare promotion through the Outrigger Resorts. We loved it.
