Sometimes, I felt that the place is too far from the Lahaina main center (harbor). If you want to go the room in the middle of the day from the activities, then you spend a lot of time driving. There is fast food, gas, chinese restaurant etc in walking distance. Safeway, Longs, Foodland, Star markets, starbucks, pizza hut, quizon's sub etc are within 15 mins drive.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: madkrish
Reviews.Content: We rented a studio condo (ocean view) in outrigger royal kahana. We really loved the place. We first got a studio assigned in the 7th floor which didn't have a very direct view of the ocean, so when we asked for another room, the staff was very flexible. We stayed in the 11th floor. Amazing view of the ocean, daily room service was great. There was no dishwasher which was a bummer but the room service person would wash the dishes for us, that was sweet!!:) The last thing we wanted to do was dishes there!! The beach outside is not much of a beach, good for a small walk or a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: eyelive2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Kahana Dec. 16-22. The room was fine, no complaints. We had an Oceanview Studio. It wasn't the Ritz but was fine for us as we spent very little time in the room. It was nice to have the washer/dryer and kitchen. The no smoking rule is a major pain so if you're a smoker, be prepared. They have an area out back by the pool where you can light up. When we booked the vacation in August, we had a smoking room. The law changed in Hawaii in November and now you have to be 20 or 25 feet away from public buildings. The beach and in your car seemed to be the only safe spots. The Mai Tai party was fun. We felt they should do it more than one night (Thursday's 4:30-5:30pm) because we met the other guests and enjoyed visiting with them. It's a good way to mingle if you're into that sort of thing. We saw a lot of whales from our balcony so bring binoculars. We did the Ultimate Whale Watch from slip 17 at Lahaina Harbor and it was worth every penny. These guys know their stuff and get you right up in the middle of numerous whales FAST. The boat only holds 18 people so it was easy to see whales on both sides of the craft. Fantastic trip and you can do a second trip for half price. The road to Hana was spectacular as was the drive up to the Haleakala Summit. Be sure to stop at Hana Bay Juice Co. in Paia on the way and get sandwiches for a picnic lunch for both trips. They are heavenly. We enjoyed the resort location. Easy access to everything and beautiful sunsets. We would stay there again. Thanks Royal Kahana for a memorable stay. I wish we could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Royal Kahana excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Blondesteven
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in two oceanview studios (#603, #605) for five nights over Thanksgiving, and had a great time. The plusses include good ocean views, very comfortably furnished units, a/c worked perfectly (the building is upgrading the systems to operate when the sliding door is closed), easy parking (both above ground and in the covered garage), and a really nice staff. Both rooms were furnished nicely with comfortable beds, all kitchen amenities, a washer/dryer (with one box of soap provided for 1 load). The property is oceanfront; however, the beach disappears at high tide. We did not utilize the tour desk. The property is within walking distance to a nice retail center with McDonalds, Maui Brewing Company (excellent), Roys (excellent), coffee and other services. It's also one mile to the Star Market (excellent grocery store) and one mile to the wonderful Napili Bay (swimming, snorkeling). We would definitely stay here again, as there is nothing else of this quality and location for such a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: dustyo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our friends for 7 days in October. This was our first trip to Hawaii. The hotel/condo was great. The room had 2 bedrooms, 2 1/2 baths, kitchen and large livingroom and diningroom. The kitchen was fully equipped with nice appliances, dishware, cooking utensils even a washer and dryer. The only complaints that we had was the faint smell of mold, the indoor outdoor carpeting on the balcony, it stayed wet from the rain so you couldn't walk on it with bare feet or in our socks. The bathroom rugs were kind of dirty looking so I covered them with towels. These were very small problems considering the other great features of the hotel. The staff was wonderful. The pool and pool area very clean. The pool's lady's room even had a blow dryer and shower. The small beach was very clean. The hotel is very close to shopping and eating places, everything from McDonald's to Outback. We would stay at this hotel again. The ocean view room was very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: runs_alot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Royal Kahana in November 2006. It was a great hotel/condo for the money and location. You are not far away from Lahaina Town (about 10-20 minutes depending on traffic - yes there is traffic in Paradise!) and you are close to pretty much everything. We had room #1213, which I HIGHLY recommend. It had an awesome view of the water and of the gorgeous Maui sunsets! It was pretty up-to-date decor wise. All tropical beachy stuff. Our room had a full kitchen and washer/dryer. There were even beach chairs in the closet! The Royal Kahana had a smallish pool and great access to the ocean. The beach was small and shrunk even more during high-tide. They have beach towels that you can check out during your stay. The staff was extremely friendly! Everyone was so helpful and accomodating. Even at the Expedia.Fun! desk they were pleasant. Here is a tip - book your activities at the Royal Kahana and don't be fooled by other activities desks in town - we found them sort of scary. Plus, you really get great deals. They offer wireless internet access on their website, but it's at a cost of $9.95 a day. I thought that was a bit high, I'm used to getting it for free at a lot of hotels I have stayed at. One last and final tip. Always LOCK your car and take EVERYTHING out overnight. We were stupid and left a cooler and a few small articles in our Jeep (with the top down) overnight on our last night. We were tired and didn't want to deal with it. Our small cooler was stolen out of our Jeep. It was sort of funny, but kind of violating at the same time. Be CAREFUL - you're in paradise, but watch your back at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Wayne Derek
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay directly with Outrigger, the building was a little dated and could use some renovations, which they were doing during our stay to one unit below us and we were not made aware of this in advance or upon check in. We checked in to a notice that on the first day of our stay a work crew was coming in to our unit to work on the Air conditioning system. We made it clear that we did not want any workers in our unit during our stay. The next day we were awakend to the sound of hammering and power tools from the floor below us and a notice that the water was to be turned off in our unit. The next day to the sound of jack hammers and tools also from the floor below us. Messages to management went unreturned. Visits to the office were turned away due to meetings. Finally as we were checking out we made a final phone call to the condos head office and registered a complaint only then did they wake up and the Manager came out of his office to talk to us. So after 4 days of noise and disturbance we were given 1 day off of our stay cost. We would definitley NOT go back to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: love2travel56757
Reviews.Content: It is so hard to know what kind of hotel to stay in when you live so far away and have to rely on others reviews for information. I think really, it just depends on the person. And a lot of people have different experiences each time they go. I think its what you make out of it, and not to expect some 10 star hotel and not to pick at every little thing. Our experience at the Royal Kahana hotel was pretty good. It was our first time in Hawaii and we werent expecting anything other than a comfortable stay. The location is pretty good-- driving distance to Lahaina and other towns were within good driving time. Kahana isnt in the middle obviously but it didnt take long at all to travel to other towns. There are a few shops here and there in Kahana but it is a pretty good town to stay in. Less busy-- i guess i wouldnt recommend staying in Kannaapali or Lahaina if you want a lot of people. Kahana was perfect for us! The non satisfactory things: It was a bit windier up there-- which made it hard to sit on the beach. But, not a huge deal, just go to another beach! There's a bunch of them. Speaking of beaches, the beach outside of the hotel is VERY narrow. That's the worst part of the hotel. Just the wind and the beach. But, the pool is nice, kinda small, but just fine. On our stay, we found that a lot of citizens were staying there, and they hogged the pool :) The staff girls were very friendly and did what they could to make our stay enjoyable. Mold I spose might be a problem. My husband noticed it right away, but they switched rooms for us -- it just depends how full they are. You might not be so lucky if all their rooms are full. They also upgraded us at a lower price, too. But they definetly did what they could. They dont have breakfast there, but do have full kitchens which made it easy for us to go to a grocery store to get breakfast stuff, milk, juice, and of course, water. Although, the food at the grocery store was expensive , too. They have a good pizza place and a subway nearby -- probably 2-3 blocks away and a pizza hut as well. They are in strip malls. The pizza hut is along the main road to get to the hotel. They also have some stores and a couuple restaurants, atm machine, and other things all within walking distance of the hotel. A mcdonals is nearby too. Very convienient. In that little strip mall they have a computer place (fee was 5 minutes or something for 2 dollars, i cant remember) . it was in an ice cream shop. overall, i was worried with some of the reviews, and also b/c my husband is really picky and is used to staying at nice hotels, but this was pretty good for us. we really really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: buffettgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and overall enjoyed it very much. The location is very convenient to Lahaina, Kaanapali, and Kapalua, and the price was excellent for this area. There is not much of a beach to speak of, but the view of Molokai and Lanai in the distance is great. We stayed in a studio ocean view. It was quite spacious for two people and it had a full kitchen with pretty much all the utensils you would need. We also loved the fact that there was a washing machine and dryer!!! The furnishings (as well as the general appearance of the property) were a bit outdated, but very clean and comfortable. We didn't use the pool, and it didn't really look like anything special. There was no bar (or restaurant), which was a little disappointing, but there was one two doors down at the Sands of Kahana. They had a nice little bar by their pool with a view of the ocean and great happy hour specials. It could be reached from the road or by walking along the water, which we preferred. There were also many restaurants and a shopping center within walking distance. In fact, the meal we had at the Maui Brewing Company just up the road was one of the best of the whole trip. The service was generally good, especially the woman who checked us in - we arrived just before 11:00 am and even though check-in is not until 3:00 pm, she cheerfully moved things around to get a room ready for us. It was very nice that we were able to lock up our bags in storage the morning of check-out so we could roam around freely until our 11:00 pm flight. The only glitch was that the wake-up call I requested for the first morning never arrived. I also thought it was a little cheap that they only give you one packet of coffee for your coffee maker, and if you want more they charge you $1.00. Oh well. This would be a great place to spend an extended stay and I would definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: UCF_Shipper
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Maui. We stayed for three days in a one bedroom ocean front room. It was very reasonably priced. We absolutely loved it! The staff was very friendly. We had plenty of room and it was nice having the kitchen. We were able to shop for groceries and cook a few meals in. The furnishings were nice and the room was very clean. Our view from the lanai was terrific, I loved watching the sunset from there. The location was very close to Lahaina and shopping. We will definitely be coming back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Time to gut the building”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in late august early september. First the good. Great location right on the beach, although not much beach right there as most of it has washed away. Fantastic ocean views. Staff pleasant enough. Good size room(1 Bedroom). Now the bad. Property needs to be gutted. Had two different rooms and both rooms really did not have properly functionong air conditioning. The stench from the mold within the in house air conditioning system was enough to make me happy to check out. Every time we returned to our room you could certainly smell the mold. Not to mention condensation forming on the a/c vents at the hottest part of the day. Made management aware of this and the "fixed" the problem. Hole in wall from shower head in bathroom was also a nice touch. 1 of 3 elevators that was out of service for half of our stay. Believe me the list goes on and on. I would not stay there again for what it cost, and I'm surprised outrigger sells this as their brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: westcoastmama
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Royal Kahana. We booked directly with the owner so we knew which condo we were staying in and what it looked like. This condo was completely remodelled with nothing spared, I would say the decor, appliances rival any 5 star resort. The owner was accommodating and the resort staff were friendly and helpful. There was air conditioning but we had it on low as the breeze was enough for us. Trust me, I am someone who could have the air conditioning on all year round. We were a party of 4 adults and 2 small children, we were very comfortable. I agree the property is dated but I think that it's unfair to give the entire resort a negative review when it's really certain individual units that are subpar. The pool was big, never crowded. It was heated and I didn't feel it was too hot, it was great for the kids. I would definitely return to the Royal Kahana and to the suite we were in. If anyone wants pictures or has questions I would be happy to email.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Run Down - Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: MoreVacationsPlease
Reviews.Content: Property needs a renovation: - Air conditioning could barely keep the rooms cool - Carpets worn - Elevators dirty - Rust in many locations within the condo unit Be careful of "Ocean View" description - Yes, you can see the ocean, but in many units, you mostly see another nearby condo building On the positive side: - The check-in staff was friendly - The 2 bedroom condo was spacious

Reviews.Title: “Only if Unit 110”
Reviews.Author: charonthego
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at The Royal Kahana, August 2006. This stay started off in unit 1001, which is considered a two bedroom, two-bath ocean view room. DO NOT RENT THIS UNIT until it is updated or remodeled. It is a step below a Motel 6. I think the towels were extra large dishtowels. I wouldnâ€™t even was my dog in the master bath. Two holes in the bathtub along with large cracks that were rusted and a showerhead that was full of mildew. The bathroom sink had a large rust ring around the cold-water handle. Along with that, the king bed was so uncomfortable; there was no way to get a good night sleep. The kitchen was a walk in pantry and I could touch both walls with my arms reached out at the same time. The washer handle was broken off and you had to have super human strength to open the sliding doors on all the closets. The sofa and carpet were damp and the room smelled like a gym locker. I think you get the picture. How a name like Outrigger can associate and rent out this unit is beyond me. As we told the manager of Royal Kahana, donâ€™t rent the unit and the owner will be forced to fix the problems. We were finally able to move to another room 220 which was a garden view room. So much for my ocean. This move was equal to a Holiday Inn. At least it was clean and felt much more comfortable. Outdated TV in the master bedroom. Still not up to my experience of the first time I stayed at this property. The first time at this property was in unit 110, which is the only unit I would stay in. All the modern comforts of home, well furnished and appointed. Clean and upscale. Excellent beds, TVs and great kitchen. If you are going with families, the property itself is average and works well with children/teenagers. The pool is not crowded and the beach works even as small as it is. It is an easy drive to the other west areas of Maui. I doubt Iâ€™ll stay there again. This experience really did put a damper on our trip and we did not get fully settled into the new room until our 3rd day. Trying to move 2 adults and 3 teenagers along with the food we purchased is not an easy task. Our friends were at the Westin Villas, which were lovely. Iâ€™ve also stayed at the Hyatt Regency. Resort over condoâ€¦hmmmmmm! Not a hard choice if I had to pick this property again. As far as activities, the Old Lahaina Luau is the best. Also the full day hike by Hike Maui was wonderful. Our guide Helga was full of great facts about Maui and extremely knowledgeable. Pacific O is great for dinner and very romantic. We walked to the Ritz Carlton for breakfast. Worth the 8 mile roundtrip walk. We purchased our fruit at the Famerâ€™s Market, it was fresh and worth the extra money. I prefer shopping a the Safeway in Lahaina versus the Star Market. Costco by the airport is always good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maui4EverWoman
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Royal Kahana 7/31-8/05/06. We were celebrating our 23rd wedding anniversary and it was just the two of us. We had studio unit 305. It had an ocean view! It had everything we needed! What was great was that we could go down to the pool mid afternoon and find 2 lounge chairs with no problem, unlike alot of the large hotels, where people put towels on chairs at 7 AM to reserve them. We really enjoyed laying on the chaise lounges on the grass right by the beach. It was nice and quiet. Go to the market up the road toward Napili to stock up the fridge. There is shuffleboard and ping pong available around the pool area, another great surprise. Our unit had a washer/dryer too. I would love to stay in a 2 bedroom next time when we bring our kids. We'll definately be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Kahana was the perfect place for us to spend our honeymoon in - away from all the crowds at Kaanapali, yet close enough (5 miles) to Lahaina, where we ate fabulous dinners every night. The Royal Kahana is not a deluxe hotel, it is a clean, quiet, family-oriented beachfront condo / hotel, so if you are expecting otherwise, you should investigate staying in Kaanapali's resort hotels or in Kihei / Wailea. For our money, it was fabulous - room 402 has a breathtaking view of the ocean and the island of Molokai from the private lanai, which also overlooks the landscaped courtyard. The pool is very nice with plenty of chairs, and the hotel staff were great and very helpful. We liked having a washer/dryer in the room, and the small kitchenette helped us save tons of money on breakfast / lunches. Daily maid service is a huge plus - they even did our dishes! We would absolutely recommend the Royal Kahana to anyone looking for a relaxing, clean, budget-friendly place to stay on the beautiful westside of Maui - we will be back very soon!! P.S. Get up early and take the road to Hana - Wainapanapa's black sand beaches are a must-see. Also, the Old Lahaina Luau is the best on the island, backdropped by gorgeous sunsets over the ocean. And, last but not least, splurge for dinner at Pacific'o - the best meal we have ever had, hands down. Hope this review is helpful to you! Aloha! Janda & Christian, Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: ShawneeKansasGinger
Reviews.Content: We visited the Royal Kahana week of 5/20 - 5/28 - it was wonderful! We had a condo on the 11th floor and the view was spectacular - wasn't sure what to expect as we hadn't ever rented a condo before - the rooms were large and well appointed. The king bed was firm and the kitchen was stocked with everything we needed. It wasn't the fanciest place you've ever seen but it was clean and quiet. Glad we didn't pay big bucks for someplace we weren't in that much. The Molokini snorkel & Hana trip were highlights. Roy's is great as usual (this is our 5th trip to the islands) and we found Dollies for sandwiches and pizza. Would stay there again if we go back to Maui - K.C.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Condo ever!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLarry
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 30th anniversary trip and stayed at the Royal Kahana Outrigger. Our large and clean condo was like a penthouse with a wrap around balcony overlooking the ocean. We sat out there on the rockers every night watching the sun set and listening to the waves crash over the reefs about 50 yards out. Specacular view from the top floor! While its true that their beach isn't in the best shape, we walked it often and there are plenty of other sandy beaches nearby. The weather was perfect with a few days of trade winds keeping everything nice and cool. Best place I've ever stayed. I loved the area, no crowds and quiet refreshing relaxation. We will stay there again. I've read the reviews about the slow elevators, but they must have fixed them because they were very fast. Their free Thursday night Mai Tai party at the Cabana by the pool was most excellent. Good Mai tai and plenty for everyone. Really nice. Pool was clean and lovely. Great place, no complaints at all. Good maid service too.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Kahana was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly researched the accommodations on Maui as my wife can be very critical and picked the Royal Kahana based on the reviews on this web site. The reviews for the Royal Kahana were generally very favorable, given the price, so we went with some expectations for at least a nice place. I am very happy to report that our room exceeded our expectations. The room was nicely decorated, nicely furnished and most of all very clean. My wife couldn't have been happier. Our accomodations couldn't have been nicer. Too bad I can't say the same for the weather. It was rainy or cloudy the entire week. Oh well, at least we had a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bdawg
Reviews.Content: We had a studio condo but had plenty of room. The complex was nice and clean. The view was fantastic, and we enjoyed the whale watching each day. Thursday Mai-Tai party was a great time to meet new friends. The Royal Kahana is nearer to Kaanapali than Lahaina in a more secluded, quiet area than all the business of the resorts near Lahaina; and this is what we loved. The bathroom was bit small, but it was okay. We'd visit here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BevS79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana from Feb 20-25,2006. Wasn't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly suprised. We came to Maui with another couple and renting the condo with 2 bdr. It was great having all that room and a full kitchen. When we entered our condo, we all dropped our luggage at the door and quickly went to the balcony to take in the wonderful view. It was very clean and very comfortable. Having the maid service was great. We watched the whales every morning and evening that we had time for. Everything about this place exceeded our expectations and more. No it isn't a hotel admostephe, matter fact we stayed at the Westin 2 years ago and with all the people there we prefered the Royal Kahana over that. It was so peacful and relaxing. They also have a small workout room. The activity desk was very helpful in planning our time in Maui. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: AZgirl40
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the ORK! We would definitely stay here again. Initially we were sort of hesitant to stay here, as there were some negative reviews, but we were very happy with our stay. We were upgraded to an oceanview room for FREE when we checked in. We stayed in unit 417 and found it clean and everything in the unit worked well. Lanai with oceanview, kitchen with fridge, TV, micro, washer and dryer (even included complimentary detergent). We didn't use any of the facilities at the hotel like the pool b/c we were too busy doing stuff away from the hotel. The only negative thing (and it's not even that big of a deal) was that parking seemed to fill up really quickly in the lot and we often had to squeeze into a really tight spot in the covered parking lot, which made for some awkward maneuvering. This was a great value for our money and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW...Had a great holiday at the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana from Jan. 15th to Feb.3rd and had a wonderful time. We rented direct from owner and the two bedroom ocean front condo was perfect. The kitchen is well equiped, which was great as we like to cook some meals in. Everything was very clean and a great supply of towels and beach toys. I really can't imagine anyone calling down Maui as a horrible place to vacation. Yes , it is expensive but so is Europe. I guess Mexico is the place to go if you want cheap. As for a convience store and places to eat, take a walk across the street. There is three restaurants in the Gateway Shopping centre as well as gift shops and a gas station and convience store that sells everything. Turn right out of the drive-way of the Royal Kahana and drive along lower Honoapilani and with in two miles there are many restaurants, fish market, and a Star Market for groceries. We found the location of the Royal Kahana Resort perfect. We found the staff very helpful as was the owners we rented the condo from. We are booked to return next year and looking forward to it. I like a place where it is safe to have drinks with good ice-cubes. Aloha ...Love you Maui...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Outrigger Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: 918SHARKBOY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Outrigger Royal Kahana in May of 2005. Although we were originally booked for a garden view, I called a day prior to our arrival and asked if there might be a free upgrade to an ocean view. Was advised to inquire again once we actually arrived. What a surprise to learn upon our arrival that the free upgrade had been taken care of with the reservations clerk I had spoken with the day before. The view from our lanai was awesome and the room had everything we needed. (In-room safe, washer/dryer, fridge, stove, coffemeaker, utencils) If we needed anything at all, day or night, all we had to do was ask. Although this resort lacks any dining, there is plenty of places to eat within minutes. The beach was nice and so were the many gorgeous sunsets. I loved sleeping to the sounds of the surf each night through the open lanai door. The air is super clean on Maui and the locals a very friendly. Don't recall hearing any sirens the entire visit? We are looking forward to our 2nd visit this coming May. We would HIGHLY recommend the great value and service offered by this resort. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “temper your expectations”
Reviews.Author: edboogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights on Jan 18th. We have been to Maui several times and decided since this was only a 4 night stay we were going to SPLURGE and upgrade to an OCEAN FRONT 1 bedroom unit. What a fantastic disappointment this was. Please beware. You see the building is V shaped and the tip of the V is at the ocean. We assumed we would be at the tip of the V. Turns out there are only 2 2-bedroom units at the tip of the V on each floor and all 1 bedroom units are down each side of the V. So you can only see the ocean to one side because the building blocks your view the other way. Plus we were on the opposite side of the pool, which got no sun shine the entire day. These units are Ocean view not Ocean Front. And there is a big price difference. Needless to say we were very disappointed. Our unit, #908, had new carpeting so that was nice. #908 is three units from the tip of the V. It also had a newer bed but it was a full size and the sleeper sofa was not fit for man or beast when pulled out as a bed. The kitchen and bath cabinets were extremely worn and run down. There were marks on the walls and chips in the tile floor. Actually the whole unit was very tired. The kitchen was stocked but kind of dirty and with very cheap utensils. This unit also did not have anything in the way games/puzzles/beach things for people to use. There was no music source and the VCR was not connected or plugged in. The only thing they did have was some used paper back books in the tv cabinet in the bedroom. It was like the place was cleaned out by someone. There was a very large dining area and all across it are slatted windows that open and shut. Actually these windows did not shut all the way and they open to the outdoor hallway. Well as you can imagine the wind was whipping thru those windows howling like crazy. They had the closing mechanisms replaced on some but still did not close all the way. And the bathroom with the toilet and the tub also had the same windows. It was kind of creepy taking a shower and having the howling wind blow on you while you hear people talking outside the window. The washer and dryer in the unit are nice and are a stacked unit. There also was a huge walk in closet that had a safe, but you had to go to the front desk to get the key for the safe. The balcony was large and had a table and 4 chairs but the handle on the screen was missing and it kept coming off the track. The pool is small and kidney shaped. The beach was maybe 10 ft deep at most and there really is no place to lay out here. Housekeeping was spotty at best, and we never got the same amenities 2 days in a row. We had to go and ask to buy the coffee replacements. The thursday party with free mai tais and chips was great. And yes, they were very generous with the rum. The Kahana Gateway center was walking distance, if you can walk up a small hill. Roys and Fish and Game had excellent food. The location is very nice, only 5 minutes to Kaanapali and maybe 10 to Lahaina. The walking distance to Gateway center was great also. If our unit was not so run down and dumpy, with a king size bed, and we had not paid for and expected to be able to see the ocean when we looked both ways it would have been a much better stay. As long as your expectations are not too high you will be happy. Especially if you get a nicely maintained unit.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised after reading some previous reviews. Stayed in 1 bedroom unit that was spacious and clean. Housekeeping even did dirty dishes. Whale-watched from balcony. Would definitely recommend to anyone. Would return again to Outrigger.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cajunawlins
Reviews.Content: With the mixed reviews, I was a little leary, but upon arrival my mind changed quickly. Things I liked: 1. Quick check in 2. Very Nice staff 3. Spacious room with private master bedroom (king sized bed) 4. Beautiful ocean view from the balcony 5. The condo owners had everything we needed there- fully equipped kitchen, snorkle gear, beach toys, beach mats, etc. 6. Activities desk- they were cheaper on most things than going out and buying direct, convienient, NO Timeshare!! 7. Most important- Thursday evenings they served free MaiTais which were Perfect and Delicious (they did not scamp on the rum!) Things I did not like: 1. Very light housekeeping- basically emptying trash cans, replinishing towels, and sometimes making the bed. Granted most days we made the bed ourselves. 2. Only one pack of complimentary coffee. I'm a coffee drinker, so the one pack of coffee did not last the entire stay (12 nights). When I asked for more, I was told I had to buy it from them. It was cheaper to buy from the store. 3. The beach- It wasn't god-awful or anything, but with so many other beautiful beaches (Ka'anipali and Honoloa being so close) I chose not to spend more than 10 minutes on the Kahana beach. But, in fairness, the beach was perfect for late night strolls, and it was very quiet. All in all I would definately stay here again. It was definately worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Got Sunburned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To start off we arrived at Kahalui Airport in the afternoon and proceeded directly to Costco as someone had suggested. After picking up a few items, diapers, water, and other items, we then proceeded to the hotel (About a 45 minute drive) but well worth it. The hotel lies north of Lahaina by 15 minutes, and north of Kannapali by 5:00 minutes. We turned into the hotel which is very large, 12 stories. The most important things for us because we were traveling with a 22-mos. old was a non-smoking room. I also wanted wanted to be on a high floor for views. I was hoping to be on at least the 3rd or 4th floor. We were greated by all staff courtiously and when we checked in it was a wonderful surprise to found out we got a room on the 12th floor! Wow!!! Room 1204. We had reserved a oceanfront studio and were we surprised by our view. Beautiful room with washer dryer oven, microwave and large fridge. The hotel is older but for what you pay it is well worth the money. The views of Molokai are amazing, and on our last day we saw a whale breach from our room about a 1/4 mile out. WOW!!!! There are some things to know when you travel to Maui. First, expect to get hit up for a timeshare at least once. Second, Plan to spend more than you think on food. Each meal for us averaged about $50 bucks except for lunches at Subway and McDonalds. The Outback steakhouse is extremely expensive but close for the first night meal. Recommendations.... Go down to Kaanapali and the Whalers Village and have dinner at Leilani's. They have an upper area for formal dinners and a lower area that is open next to the beach with sunset views. The lower area has inexpensive meals burger fries, and other meals for 9-11 dollars. (this is a good deal for the area). I ordered the Mahi Mahi fish of the day which was $14.00. WOW!!!!!! I highly recommend this to everyone We ate here 3 times. Maui Dive shop for snorkeling gear. Best Snorkel spots...Milemarker 14. For the brave, drive out to Hana. There is a park there in town with a beautiful beach and concrete peir. Snorkel on the ocean side of the pier. Rougher water but deep with BIG fish. Go to Napili beach beautiful Do the drive to Hana. For those with infants who want the ocean but worried about waves. There is a great park about 5 miles south of Lahaina. Don't remember the name but you drive 5 miles south and come to a stop light. (It is NOT Shaw Street). Pul into this park. They have a protected rock jetty that contains shallow water that the kids can play in. There is small fish, crabs in here which will make it a learning adventure as well. If you sit real still the little fish will come up to you and swim all round you, between your fingers and nip at you lightly. It is lots of fun. Bottom line is this. This is a great hotel for what you pay. Staff is courtious and friendly views are a 10, beach is good, pool is good Free Mai-Ti's on Thursdays are great. I strongly recommend this hotel for budget travelers, or those with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experiance at the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana from Nov 21 to Dec 1 2004 room 1210 Ocean view 1 beroom it had everything we needed kitchen with the full refrigerator, stove\oven, microwave and dishwasher. There was even a washer & dryer (next time I won't take so many clothes or beach towles (They had nice size towles you would sign out each day). We had room service every day so we could leave the breakfast dishes and the beds unmade and when we got home the dishes were in the dish washer clean and ready to use agian, the beds were made and floors vacumed. Whice was really nice since we were gone site seeing every day no later then 7am The price was reasonable. I had read other reviews and the biggest thing was to be between floor 10 and 12 I now know why, any farther down and you are to low all you'll see is the pool or a wall. We went with the ocean view room because our travel agent got us an upgrade from garden view. which was cheaper, and the Ocean Front was higher. Once we got there we thought the the ocean view was the best choice Ocean front all you see is the Ocean and Garden view all you see is the garden. The view from our balcony was spectaular we had the ocean to our rigth and the mountains to the left. We can not wait to go back to Maui and we will diffently stay at the Royal Kahana agian. This is a little more secluted so if you want to be right in the thick of the night life this isn't it, but Kaanapali is only about 5min and Lahaina is about 10min south so if you want to stay were it is a little quiter but be close to other things this is the place. The beaches here are the best but agian isn't to far from better ones like Kapalua just a little north. Old Lahaina Lua is a most.

Reviews.Title: “Totally dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: travaldiva
Reviews.Content: I should of known it was going to be bad when I read all the reviews here. I usually come here and read and when the majority is bad I change hotels... it seems the last few people gave it the thumbs up so we went with it. We went to Maui for my brothers wedding. There are a lot of hotels in Maui that dont even advertise on the net and I wish I would of stayed elsewhere. I called the hotel a few days before we left. We live on the east coast and it was going to be a LONG day and I did not want anything left to chance... first of all I called five times trying to get to the *reservations department* guess what? they only have ONE PERSON for the entire building that could handle the reservation... her name is Michelle and she is very very hard to get a hold of. She wont return voice mail so I kept on till I got a hold of her. I wanted to make sure she had us down and we had asked for a King smoking room... she said yes we had both in the computer. First of all this condo building has very high prices and advertises oceanfront... I have traveled the world including Oahu but have never been to Maui and ONLY went because of the wedding. It seems Maui is one over priced adventure and all in all I will never go back there. We went to the store and a box of cereal is $5.00 and yes this was at Safeway not some small gas station. The beach sucks at this hotel. It is a small plot of blackish brown dirt with lots of rocks...NOT like Waikiki which is white sand and blue water. The ocean was dark and murky green and nasty and muddy ground that will suck you down if your not careful. Ok we drove from the airport in the dark due to a four hour travel delay out of LAX... it was dark and we needed directions...the hotel was clueless on how to tell us how to get there and we eventually just followed highway 30 to Lahaina and actually the hotel is in Kahana up the road... also when I was on the phone with them at home they said many places to eat just walking distance across the street...that is a total lie. They have a Mcdonalds which for two people costs $11-15 dollars ordering value meals.... that is the closest place to eat then they have a outback steack house and thats it. You have to DRIVE everywhere if you want something to eat or go to the store and cook on your vacation. There is NO gift shop or convenience store located on the property so come prepared with band aids, aspirin, drinks ect ect... the parking sucks its all close together jammed with a million rental cars and every night at least three times a rental car alarm would go off for a minute straight. We checked in and the girl working the desk said yes we had a smoking room and a king bed... dont look for a bell hop...they dont have any. We lugged our stuff upstairs and it was a NON smoking room with a queen bed and a twin bed... I called down for a ashtray... yes we are smokers and I like to keep things cleaned up and not drop ashes in the sink or out on the deck... we had to use a gatorade bottle and asked for three days in a row and never got a ashtray....the next person said we were in a non smoking room so I told her to check with the person who checked us in because we had already smoked in the room for two days... Im saying all this because for a person who is allergic to smoke they would not be happy checking in after a smoker. The room was basic and the carpets were dirty. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen and reminded me of my last visit to London with the small baths in the hotels there. The bathroom also has NO a/c and no fan...they want you to crank open these acient window slats to get the hot humid air so you will sweat to death after your bath or shower. The toilet ran for two days straight as the chain was getting caught up on a piece of plumbing that was falling apart so everytime someone used the toilet you had to remove the lid and untangle the mess. We reported this to the front desk and no one ever came to straighten it out. They have a very tiny pool for all the guests to use... you think it would be larger or they would have at least two of them. My other family members stayed at other hotels around Lahaina and Kannapoli... we had the dumpiest hotel and everyone was suprised to see the lack of facilites including a sauna that does not work and a dusty small workout room. We spent a lot of money to stay at this dump and I would not recommend it to anyone and NO this was not our cheapest option. Maui all in all is totally overpriced and I would take our favorite spot which is Cancun which is closer and better and all inclusive for a fraction of the price over Maui anyday of the week. They have a lot of overpriced tourist things to do and we knew better then to pay $200 to bike down Haleakala at the crack of dawn.... if you want to do these things SHOP AROUND.... I saw Lu'aus for $19.00 at the Marriot (my sister stayed here) and my family went to the Old Lahaina Lu'ua for my brothers reception which was sooo boring and it was $85.00 a person plus tax and gratuity.... this is my fifth Lu'ua and it was not worth the money and the meal was just so so... downtown Lahaina they have many places to book parasailing, biking the volcano, snorkeling, L'uaus ect ect DONT GET RIPPED OFF... we drove everyday to get to a decent beach and stayed away from the sharks who are dying to take your money. If anyone has any questions please email me.. I speak nothing but the truth... read back and see I was not the only one who thinks this is a really crappy condo building with really crappy service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Royal Kahana is a very clean, off-the-beaten-"resort"-track kind of hotel. we found not pretensious but a very accomidating staff very willing to please. We had a second story "garden view studio" unit and found it to be perfect for my wife and me to use as a "base" for travels around Maui. We even had an ocean view from our lanai which we didn't expect! The beach is great to walk on after diner but one will need to do a little driving to get to a good swiming/snorkaling beach. A solid vacation value that I would reccomend, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 13 month old boy and I stayed in 702, and had a terrific view of Molokai. As with the other reviews, I'll agree that this hotel was not a 5 star hotel, but at a 5 star hotel one feels 'uneasy' walking through the lobby in swimsuits or fishing poles. At the Royal Kahana, I felt comfortable doing so (actually, with sandy feet, etc, you could reach the beach by way of the basement). The beach was great (better than Kaanapali!). The northern side was a little too grassy for swimming, but the southern side was coral....lots of fish to see (especially the state fish: Humuhumunukunukuapua'a). The room was fine, and the housekeeping swept and made the bed, but didn't do the dishes or wipe up the counters. I'll chalk it up to the mostly slow-pace of life of the Hawaiian housekeepers. Mahalo. The best breakfast could be had next door at the Sands of Kahana. Lahaina is pretty close in too for the touristy shopping. Great golfing is close by in Kapaluha. In my opinion, Kahana was easier, cheaper, more fun and friendlier than Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised with the room, it beat our expectations especially for the price. The views from room were unbeatable, words cant explain the sunsets from the Lanai. Keeping the windows and sliding door open aall the time, falling asleep and waking up to the ocean sounds was music to our ears. What a relaxing stay we had at the RKR, we will coming back!!!!! There is not much of a beach here, nice for little walks in the morning and evenings other beaches are just a short drive. It was very nice to be away from the crowds. The only problem was we arrived at the RKR at noon and could not check in until 3 pm but our room wasnt ready until 4 pm., took a drive up the coast and then to Lahina . The wait for the room was worth it, just to see the views of the ocean as you walk in....

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we'd expected”
Reviews.Author: cngregoire
Reviews.Content: Normally when using Tripadvisor, I look at the overall rating more than specific reviews of mediocre or bad experiences, however my husband and I spent the first week of our honeymoon here this month and were a little disappointed. We booked a "suite" on Orbitz, and were sold by the promised use of kitchen facilities and the 5th night free promotion. Including paying $0 for the 5th night, we paid an average of $190/night for 5 nights, and didn't feel that it was really worth it. Granted, MAUI IS EXPENSIVE. (Other islands such as Kauai and Hawaii - the big island - are much less touristy and greener) NEGATIVES: - This hotel is a little rundown, and although in a convenient location to drive to places, there wasn't anything to do within walking distance - Although it is true that all rooms are oceanview, our 2nd to last room had to gaze out to the left to see the ocean. (See uploaded photo) - Our "suite" was really an oversized hotel room (no separate bedroom and a kitchenette along one wall.) (See uploaded photo) - The beach at the hotel is very small and not great for either swimming or sunbathing. No others within walking distance. - Internet access is either dial up in the rooms or wireless that wasn't working in the common area (but no one knew why) POSITIVES: - The staff was pleasant, things were clean - The pool was nice - Not too many loud kids since the area (Kahana section of Lahaina) was sort of isolated - Local Fish Market (called 'Got Fish') had good fresh fish to grill on the resort's barbeques - For the most part, the kitchenette had adequate cooking supplies. (Hit the Safeway in Lahaina for best prices) IF I HAD TO DO IT ALL OVER AGAIN: On Maui, the nearby KAANAPALLI area is much nicer, has a boardwalk, and some good beaches with common activities such as volleyball or restaurants. However, there are more kids and it is pricy. - WAILEA on the southern shore is much more ritzy. - NAPILI on the northwest shore is kind of a "hidden gem" of a place to stay in - I'd go to Kauai or the Big Island, where we spent time during the second half of this trip and one other. (Their sister hotel, OUTRIGGER LAE NANI was fabulous on KAUAI)

Reviews.Title: “This place did the trick!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday in Maui and was pleasantly surprised by the room we received at the RKR. I was a bit hesitant staying at a condo resort since it is up in the air how your room will look but I loved the room we got. Definitely spring for the ocean view room, it is well worth the extra couple of bucks. I loved watching sunset on the lanai. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the equipment needed to cook some meals. The washer/dryer came in very handy for drying our swimming suits. The room was so spacious that I actually felt like I had an apartment for the week I was there. I would definitely stay here again. It isn't as posh as the 5 star hotels but remember you are in Maui and you shouldn't be spending that much time in the room so what does it matter?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsiu
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel thru their own website and they had a special price. We stayed at the Studio ocean view room and we were happy with the kitchenette. I recommend call after you made reservation to request for higher Floor. Probably stay at the left side (when you are facing the ocean) of the building is better. We will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching many condos on the internet in Maui we decided on the Outrigger Royal Kahana for our 25th Anniversary in April 2005. We were not disappointed. After a very long travel day of 14 hours we were greeted by a friendly receptionist. At first we couldn't get our door to open to our room but fortunately the head of housekeeping was passing by. He also tried several times and was successful to open the door. He, however, didn't feel comfortable with the safety issue and had us return to front desk. We were quickly upgraded to a larger apartment with a magnificient view of the Pacific. Our unit was always clean. We usually kept our doors open, even at night, to hear the sounds of the ocean. Would we return to the Outrigger? Absolutely! We can't think of one complaint as we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Affordable, no Gloss, Glitz or Glamor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic example of you get what you pay for. We had a 10 day stay in a very nice clean comfortable one bedroom ocean view room on the 6th. floor (615) which provided great views from both the living area and bedroom as advertized. Staff was accomodating and helpful. Public areas, pool, grills, workout room well maintained and clean. This is not a great or even a good beach area with a lot of "stuff" on the beach a lot of the time. Maui is one great big beach with good public access so this is not a big deal item. If you are expecting Sheridan atmosphere you'll be disappointed. If you want a very good value for your money, this will do very nicely. We certainly would go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet condo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The condo was awesome! It had boogieboards, snorkel gear, and other beach stuff, so we didn't have to rent anything. The view was fantastic and I could see whales swimming out in the ocean! Through the expediafun location in the lobby, we went to a luau, whale watching cruise, dinner cruise, and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “comfy/clean and inexpenive”
Reviews.Author: lou9900
Reviews.Content: the royal kahana was just fine,its not a five star i wasnt expecting a five star and it was really clean and comfortable, ii found the staff to be really friendly and kind. i knew that it wasn t the top tier of hotels in maui but i knew it wasnt creepy or dirty, the beachfront is really cool!!!!!! the whale viewing in the morning is stunning,its a great place to start the day i never spent a whole day there , we drove down to kanapalli beach almost every day.its a great value for maui and its really decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip to Maui for a specal family occasion. I had done a lot of research on the internet about hotels in Maui. We were very pleased with our stay in this location. We stayed in the one bedroom condo with our teenage daughter. There was plenty of space. The lanai was wonderful! I enjoyed sitting out there taking in the beautiful view and the warm breeze. It was also very nice to be able to do laundry in the room and have the kitchen available although we didn't cook at all. The room was very clean and everything in working order. The only thing that I would change if I could was to be able to take the lawn chairs out onto the beach. There is a pool with lawn chairs but you can not take them onto the beach and the beach is right there. We even extended our stay by a couple of days since we were having such a great time. This hotel had the beach closer to the water than any other hotels on this side of the island. We had a great time and would stay again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the condo and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip to Maui/Oahu last week and wanted to rave about the Royal Kahana. I was a little worried having read some of the bad reviews on here, but I honestly have no idea what those people were talking about. Very late at night my group of 10 arrived and were *very* pleasantly greeted by the front desk person who proceeded to upgrade all 5 of our rooms without our asking and at no charge. I was taken aback at the size of all of our 1 bedroom condos. It had a huge bedroom with a king size bed, walk in closet, vanity area and bathroom, dinning room, laundry closet, full sized kitchen and a living room. And our view was simply breathtaking. We all loved the beach and pool area although we were very busy with other activities on the island to spend a great deal of time there. Which is also why we didnâ€™t miss having a restaurant in the hotel, but we found plenty within walking distance (which we were glad to do since it was so nice outside). Once we got to Honolulu we received quite a culture shock after having such a peaceful visit in Maui. Next trip will be all Maui and all Royal Kahana!!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kahana Dec. 29, 2004 - Jan. 1, 2005. The resort is nice & right on the beach. We had a great view from our partial ocean view room. However, the resort is a little run down & lived in looking. We actually got a great deal by negotiating with the Outrigger people. (They must have regretted the deal they made because the called us back twice to see if we were really going to use our reservation-we were told our room was in high demand) Anyway it was acceptable for the price considering it is Maui, but it was not a swanky 5 star resort for sure. The staff was friendly & helpful. The pool & the beach were really nice. We would stay here again for the right price. The only bad thing was the vent in our room was covered in a years worth of dust & I ended up with a sinus infection. Bummer-next time I will bring a cloth vent filter from home depot ($10) Aside from that, I would recommend this resort to a family on a budget-that is more interested in a comfortable, affordable place to stay then in 5 star pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: PhineasFogg1899
Reviews.Content: First the room, that was very nice with a great view of the pacific. Thats where it all ends. The staff at reception has no knowledge what so ever about Maui or the Hotel programs. Security people extremely unfriendly and rude. Sat on the beach looking at the stars when the security came and took my chair away. Next day the security man stood at reception and told us that he was glad that he could help to destroy our stay as much as possible. The beach is real bad, not to mention the location. Packed our stuff and checked in at Kiehi Surfside that felt like heaven on earth compared with the Royal Kahana Resort. So, if you like a lousy beach, unfreindly reception and security people and drive all over the island this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean & Comfy hotel @ a great value. Nice staff. We had an amazing ocean view. Hotel has a nice pool and barbeque area. Rooms have a kitchen & dining area, large closet, couch had a sleeper bed.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from the Royal Kahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, we just got home last night from our week and 1/2 stay in Hawaii. The last 4 days of our vacation were spent in Maui at the Royal Kahana. There were my wife and myself and our 3 children as well as my sister-in-law. We stayed in suite 310 with the most awesome ocean front view in the world. We were there at the beginning of the whale watching season and each morning it was a treat to eat my cereal and have my coffee on the lanai and count whales. Again, I agree it's not the Ritz, or the Sheraton. But it was extremely clean and comfortable and we ALL LOVED IT! I definately will stay again, hopefully in the same room. By the way, the staff were all very friendly and helpful to us. I did not use the activities center at RK so I cannot vouch for them. Go Royal Kahana!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Royal Kahana was Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Royal Kahana from November 7th - November 14 for our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience. Granted, the hotel is not lavish and renovated from the outside, but the room we stayed in was excelent! We had a one-bedroom ocean front suite which was always kept clean by their maid service and extremely spacious. The front desk staff was very helpful and the activities desk assisted us in purchasing all of our tickets to various shows, tours and dinners. Overall, I would stay in the Royal Kahana again because for the money it truly is the best location and value.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Royal Kahana. The island of Maui is beautiful! I would definitely recommend driving the road to Hana. Dinner at Gerardâ€™s was excellent. I agree with the previous review in part. Their analogy to Kmart is quite accurate. If you donâ€™t mind a twisted version of the â€œblue light specialâ€� youâ€™ll love this hotel. Needless to say we had a couple of complaints. The housekeeping walked in on my wife as she was getting out of the shower to clean the room when we had the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign up. The second complaint we had was the lies from the concierge/excursion planner. Without mentioning names, she told several inaccuracies in order to sell trips that led to needless aggravation. Unfortunately due to my wifeâ€™s work schedule (not because it was the cheapest) we had to change our travel plans and ended up getting stuck staying at the Royal Kahana because other places were booked in advance. We will not be staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Saruhhh
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people are complaining about the Royal Kahana. You KNOW this was the cheapest place you could find. That's why you chose it. Don't expect the Ritz for your KMart price tag. My family stayed in Suite 310 at the Royal Kahana from October 29 - November 2, 2004. The suite was a two bedroom ocean front condo. Great value!! The living room was gigantic. The wrap-around balcony was awesome. We could have had more people, as the couch also folded out into a forth bed. Our suite had a king bed in one room, a twin and a double in the second bedroom, plus two and a half bathrooms. The full kitchen and full size washer and dryer made the stay very comfortable. Parking was free and ample. As for the location, it could not be more convenient. Maui didn't seem to have many sidewalks or people walking to their destinations. Most hotels seemed to be located out of walking distance to most other things (Lahaina, Napili, Kapalua). So, yes, you do have to drive to most places from the Kahana. But, I think it would be the same from ANY hotel (excpet for those in Whaler's Village). The Royal Kahana does have a great little shopping center in walking distance. It's pretty much right in front of the hotel. There's an Outback restaurant, a McDonalds, a General Store, a gas station, and two other bigger restaurants. There's also another smaller shopping center with Dollie's (GREAT pizza) and a dive shop. The pool was small, but well-kept. They cleaned it every morning. There were ample lounge chairs. The beach was clean and sandy. The water wasn't clear, but, ALL of the beaches we went to were murky (Napili, Wailea, Kapalua), due to the season. Lahaina is about a 15 minute drive. Napili and Kapalua are about 5 minutes in the opposite direction. ALL of the highways in Maui seemed to be two lanes(one going each way). So, I don't know why that other person was using the 2 lane thing against the Kahana. The highway is actually two lanes in each direction, from Lahaina to Kahana. The airport (OGG) is 45 minutes away. We paid $265 per night. It was a GREAT value that we could not beat anywhere else. This would probably be a great place in whale-watching season, as long as you get an ocean front condo. The staff was also wonderful and honest. The housekeeping staff found our cell phone after we left and turned it into the front desk. The beds were always made and clean. We had new towels every morning. All soaps and detergents were in our room waiting for us. You do have to purchase your own laudry detergent, once you use up the first box the hotel provides you with (enough for two loads). We will stay at the Royal Kahana again. As I said before, it is cheaper than you'll find anywhere else (on the Lahaina side of the island, on the water). You can definitely find something newer and more updated. But, this hotel will cover your budget and your needs.

HotelInfo.Name: Outrigger Royal Kahana
HotelInfo.Address: 4365 Lower Honoapiilani Road, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
